7QgtjJdpWTG_b6inDC-Xgg.text: Slam dunk for breakfast!  Right near the airport at Town Square mall, The Broken Yolk is casual, comfortable and friendly. Great lattes and a full bar.  The restaurant is brand new, officially opening April 15th. Bound to be a classic. Don't miss the acai bowl!

iL8ax2NCIy3RXl98C3F88Q.text: Great stop for breakfast. We stopped by straight from the airport on Easter morning. Portions are HUGE. Service was prompt and courteous. Manager was always visible.  Loved the coffee. I had several cups to wake me up after a early flight. Eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, burger topped with eggs were all delicious. Bloody Mary's looked awesome, we were sitting near the bar. One negative, onion rings were soggy and sub par to everything else we had. Found out after asking the server, this was their opening first weekend . As we leaving, this little place got packed. Will stop here everytime we are in Vegas. Don't think the chain has made it  to TX  yet.

6S16qkvmcJXsLwHzYf3GFA.text: This is a brand new place to the Valley, being open for only two weeks now. My husband and I had breakfast this morning and it was very good, and we will be back. The staff are very friendly, Bianca served us she was wonderful and very knowledgeable about the menu. We highly recommend this restaurant.

F1M6D6AeEdSYx9lnQNKWjw.text: This place is amazing! The food was beyond great! It was so nice inside and the waiters were very attentive! Can't wait to go again.

qzvi-b_HSw82y3TrzcoNtw.text: Alicia was the best!!! The food and service was wonderful. For a place open only a few days- they did a great job and had a great attitude. Thanks!

bKsts0u25L-tjmE7GyazeA.text: The Broken Yolk is a nice place for breakfast/lunch. The menu features several unique benedict creations, omelettes, mexican style dishes and some tempting sweet pancake/waffle selections, so the variety is interesting. I had a create your own omelette with chili and green onions and cheese (they actually forgot the cheese but no biggie, it was still good), hash browns and a biscuit. The portions are large, the food came out hot, the service was timely, attentive, and friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. The restaurant itself was full and pretty loud, but that's probably pretty normal for a busy breakfast place. For locals, I would put it on par with an Eggworks or Egg and I, but not quite as good as The Omelette House or the Original Pancake House. Just my own personal preference but you may have a different opinion. Definitely worth a visit though.

C8MchroqHAlgkqoubZodJQ.text: Rusty was great! We will definitely be back!! Try the mimosa flight is was wonderful! Service and atmosphere was fantastic!

A75MfD7UXwuh0ENFpJQC9w.text: The food is really good, the chilaquiles were awesome, the crepes are also very good and all of the servers are super nice! I would definitely go back soon!

I called to see their status and We were invited for the soft opening. Amanda was very pleasant on the phone. When we got there we were seated right away. The wait staff was very attentive. The manager came over and spoke with us. The food was excellent. Overall a great experience. Congrats on all their hard work in preparation for the opening.

fmQI7qD-iEx-dcWkch_TZQ.text: Wow!! Had breakfast at the new Broken Yolk Cafe!!! The Savory Crapes were amazing!! The Crunchy French toast is outta this world good!! Rusty is one of the coolest servers we've had in a long time!! He was very knowledgeable and offered some stellar service. The mimosa flight was delicious, they also offer a Bloody Mary flight as well!! The broken yolk is our new favorite breakfast spot!

rsje5GSnaIfHE81HPNRKJA.text: SERVICE IS TERRIBLE!!!!! Hands down THE worst service ever. It took away from even being able to enjoy our meal. Waited....and waited...and waited. After 20 minutes of waiting, I finally had to flag our waitress down and it seemed as if we were bothering her. So sorry I inconvenienced you to actually do your job. After that lovely encounter, our food came fairly quick. Food was decent but guess what!?! WAITRESS...somewhere, anywhere!? Nope. Empty cups, needed a box, needed the check to get out of there. Another 20 minutes, whoop!! I got up to ask the front area lady and she didn't even look up and said where's your waitress. I pointed and she said, you need to deal with her. WOW!! What is the hiring process you guys have. Hey, do you have no personality, hate people and want to piss off customers!? YOU'RE HIRED!!! Good luck with your customer service team. Have a bunch of winners. May want to wipe the place clean and start over. It's sad as the food was good. Won't go back, unless it's my day off and I have a whole day to spare, hanging around to get some eggs and get treated like crap.

IFKTNSBCNIWZ1nvf-_8apQ.text: I'm sorry to say this about the new location or maybe it was just poor training by management, but they have lost me. I have been to many of the other locations and never had this problem. First the order took forty three minutes to get with three requests on the status. I'm sorry but forty three minutes for breakfast?  Finally someone said they had a health inspector in and it was slowing things down. One, most quality locations would have said something to the newly seated customer that it may take a little longer for your food due to the inspectors visit, not done. Two, had to flag down someone twice to get a refill on my coffee. And to top it off in a most grandiosely fashion, my eggs Benedict came out with two hard boiled eggs on top and everything cold. They did do the correct thing even though I said not to, bright out two perfect eggs. But why, the meal was by then cold. Learning mode can only get you by for so long. What a shame as I have enjoyed this companies service at other locations outside of Vegas.

nDTNh-keyAUexUToKl7UAA.text: such a cute place! the atmosphere is adorable and the food is amazing, we've been here 3 times and never had a complaint

8J7svcxsZds079Mr_Y6HWQ.text: First off, I'll start by saying that the first time I went into this establishment was the first week they had opened and it was 7 of us. The food and service was great. Our waitress was very good, she didn't even need to write down our order! Ok now let's fast forward to 5/17/19 when my son decides to treat my daughter and I to breakfast. Our server was Matthew and the only words he said to us the whole time we were there was to take our order. He kept looking at us in weird way that made me feel upset and we couldn't even enjoy our meal. I would still like to know what the problem was?  Was it my sons Lakers cap? Race? What???????? The busser was very nice so I made sure to give him the tip and I hope that he didn't have to share it with Matthew. Our waiter just put our bill on the table and didn't say one word so I didn't know that you don't pay at the front anymore & I went to pay and the hostess told me that the waiter takes the payment now. I told her my experience with him and she was nice enough to take my payment for me. She also gave me the yelp card to share my comments and said that she'd let the manager know our experience. We've never experienced this type of service anywhere ever! I'm hoping that the manager does address this so that it doesn't happen to anyone else! I knew we should've stuck with Metro Diner or Eggworks. Also, this is my first time on yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Crunchy French Toast

QspK6C5LcOb4yxa6NkASgA.text: Let me first start out by saying the Customer Service was on point. The staff makes your visit an impressionable experience. Very clean, bright fun, and open atmosphere. There's seating outside (which I hope they will expand more because it wasn't a lot of room outside). There's a LOT of food for the price. Speaking of price, it's really reasonable, about $$. I had the crunchy french toast and it was TO DIE FOR!!! My honey had the waffle sandwich and he really enjoyed it.   We also arrived at a very busy time on Saturday (around 12pm) and we only had to wait about 10mins to get seated.  The only thing that could be improved in is getting bigger high top tables.  The high top tables they have now are WAY too small, especially when they have the condiments rack sitting on the table.  That alone takes up half the table space, and there is no room left for any plates, especially with the amount of plates it takes to hold all of the food that they give you.  Its DEFINITELY not enough room for 2 people to sit at.

894YaFUvWPt1XWFunNoXMA.text: First time here and it was very good! I ordered the chicken and waffles benedict with a side of fruit. The portion size isn't the biggest but it was perfect for me. I came here after the gym and drank a lot of my water prior to actually eating my meal, so take that into consideration. The flavor was very good in all parts of the meal. It's basically a chicken tender on a waffle and then the poached egg and hollandaise sauce. The chicken wasn't overly breaded and seasoned well, the the waffle was fluffy and had a decent crust on the outside, the hollandaise sauce was a great consistency and creamy! Both the poached eggs still had a great runny yolk! The only thing that I didn't enjoy was that the hollandaise sauce made the waffle very very soggy half way through my meal. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE when there is a lot of sauce, especially in the traditional eggs benedict. With english muffins, the sauce gets soaked up enough to where it softens the bread, but doesn't loose its shape. Because the waffle here is so fluffy it just turned out to be soggy. I'd probably suggest serving a light ladle of the sauce for the aesthetic look that benedicts have and probably serve the remainder in a separate sauce ramikin or something. Other then that, I would highly recommend and will be coming back!!

J3KR-d8nsR-XzLd7jhU8MQ.text: This place is bomb, I love the food. Mathew was our server & dude was cool as fuck  My mom thinks he's cute too, oh no. Will be back soon

XJnRaUo5DNdWEqY7Te4QXg.text: The search for bottomless mimosas lead us here. Although this place didn't have bottomless mimosa they had the mimosa flight that we wanted to try and it was closer to home.  It was Memorial Day, we were a party of 10 and the place was packed. The second we got there we were greeted at the host stand to put our party on the list. While waiting outside, there is complimentary water, coffee and muffin which I thought was pretty awesome.   Once seated we were greeted by the waitress for our drinks, then followed with taking our orders then followed with the delivery of the order. Everything flowed really nicely and timely. The waitress was quick, the food runners were fast and as I scanned the place the bussers were so quick to turn the table for the next party. Another great thing to see was the Manager was very hands on. He helped greet, seat, clean, opened doors etc while looking calm and collected.   Customer Service was great and even greater to see that Customer Service was not sacrificed for quick service. It was very well balanced.   Would definitely come back!!

rZOBFBZHHPTLOiUbqBLj8A.text: My wife and I were in Vegas on vacation and looking for a good breakfast place.  We used Yelp and decided to try this establishment.  The parking lot is a decent size to accommodate the cars which is great for a cafe.  The reception area is small but really efficient.  The manager welcomed my wife and I.   He was very friendly and we struck up a conversation about the LA Chargers.  Chelsea was our server.  Chelsea was prompt and efficient.  My wife ordered the ham and cheese omelette and I ordered the Golden State Benedict.  The Benedict was delicious as it had 2 strips of bacon and sriracha sauce on top of the hollandaise sauce.  The coffee was on point and the service great.  We would come back to break free from the casino buffets and restaurants.  Staff is friendly and that goes a long way in having a great experience.

u-eG69KgkRNCoNKgnIbEtw.text: After visiting San Diego and enjoying breakfast at the Pacific Beach location I was excited when I heard they opened one at Town Square!   First visit was 6/10 although we had a large party of 12 and half of them being kids, I understand it can be overwhelming. Like majority of the people in this town I have been in the service industry for 14 years and understand people have off days. So we decided to give it another try with four of us eating.  So on the second take the service was worse. The server never asked if I wanted anything to drink so I had to flag her down. No big deal! But then I had to tell her that I wanted to order food. When it finally arrived I asked for mushrooms in my omelette which there were none. So I told the runner not to worry about it, but he insisted on remaking it which took another 15 minutes. The second time it came the mushrooms weren't even cooked.   The best part of all was the Manager was busier trying to chat up the hostess rather than expedite or run the (no exaggeration) 12 plates sitting in the window. Good Luck Broken Yolk, Im sure you'll be a Chili's in about 6 months.

tD9VJY9We0p3Mui6GBV8gw.text: Excellent! Especially the Eggs Benedict and trademarked Tiki Toast. Great that it's off the strip so it's not tourist-y. All the staff is incredibly friendly. It would be great if they filtered the water.

I9YM-CJJJS5FGZhMRg6uBA.text: Located in an obscure corner in the Fry's parking lot. After I sat inside for lunch and ordered the half sandwich with soup and salad, I tried to remember the name of the restaurant I was in. This is the grand opening and I just walked in off the street with a business associate.  I looked around me, here, there, everywhere for a sign of the business. From my vantage was no clue as to the name of the place until I searched restaurants near me on Yelp and found the name.  I think that the menu items are a dollar or two pricier than they should be, which is why I am giving this a 4 star review. The food was presented on clean new white plates and bowls, which looks appetizing. For a grand opening day, I would have thought that they would do more to brand themselves for referrals and repeat business.  There were only a few balloons outside, very low key .  They don't offer any freebies on their big day.  Nothing to take away from the experience to make them standout from the nearby competitors. The only thing they did do is interrupt our eating every few minutes to ask how it was, which was a little annoying while I was writing this review and discussing business with my associate. After my meal, which was delicious, I was still hungry.  For a local who is used to paying $7 for all you can eat buffets,$30 with a tip seemed pricey.  But, again, the food is good and I will eat here again. They have a real bar, inside, which is cool and outdoor seating with a view of the free way entrance.

WwreoHCLlC74DSGTvTqVXg.text: On a golf vacation so we needed to get some hearty substantial grindz before hitting the links.  I have to say we were not disappointed.  The food was good and the service was excellent.  We were there at 6 a.m. because of our early tee times so it was not busy except I did notice a lot of take out orders being made.  Our server, Janeen was super friendly and attentive.  If you need to get a good breakfast early in the a.m., this is the place!

sY4QWSpjspudBqQpN_OICw.text: Some friends of mine came to town and were staying not too far from here, so we decided to try this place for breakfast.  One of my bosses is from San Diego and he said this place was really good.  I really didn't expect it to be as busy as it was, because they haven't been open long, and they're in a fairly new strip center.  However, for our party of three, we waited about 15 minutes at 9am on a Sunday Morning.  I must say that they staff was excellent, friendly, and helpful.  I ordered the Acai Bowl (pictured).  It was good, but it was a LOT of citric acid.  I should've gotten some bacon or hash browns or something different to go with it, to balance out the citric acid, but I did not.  But don't get me wrong, it was good & fresh.  One of my friends had one of the Benedict dishes.  She enjoyed it very much.  And her boyfriend had the Tuna Melt, which if I ate those, it looked really good.  I couldn't tell if he ordered onion rings or fries that were circular.  They looked like rings, but they also looked very small for onion rings.  I should've asked him.  The place was packed, yet it was immaculate. I definitely look forward to eating there again.  It was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CVMXANHdxVlhkVoVmtDyvw.text: Been here twice now. Everything I've gotten is delicious and the staff is very friendly. The first time, I ordered an omelette with bacon and ham and onions. The food came out fast and was delicious. My friend also ordered an omelette and while she did not say whether she enjoyed it or not, the plate was clear so I'm guessing she did. The second time, I went more traditional with the bacon and eggs plate. Also delicious. Bacon was  cooked and the eggs were fluffy. I also ordered a biscuit and you could definitely tell it was home made. Flakey, buttery, and huge. The only downside was that the jam was not home made. We also ordered a mimosa flight to share and had 4 different flavors and was reasonably priced. All in all, would recommend.

mZXTSLCy-BPlDh7_jZUH9g.text: This place is amazing! We went here for a family get together breakfast and all of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals. Great prices for the quality of food that you get. They close earlier which is to be expected, so it's nice to get there earlier. Overall experience was great, and I would go back again for sure!

Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Eggs Benedict

YyGh7z-dM8mhIMe-P4UmlQ.text: This day we decided to skip a brunch buffet instead headed to a regular serving brunch. Since it is newly open at this area most of the uber drive are not familiar with the place but if you live in Vegas or have a rented car, you can drive yourself and enjoy a massive parking space which they shared to the other establishment.  When we got in around passed noon-ish the place was not packed and got our table instantly. We sat down, ordered some drinks, and browse the menu. First, let me just say that they have a wide variety of food and drink options, and I saw a full bar so they might even have a variety of drinks (ask your server to be sure). Once we decided we got:  Mimosa - Well, I did not have this but it was in the skinny tall glass.  Soy Latte - I just started drinking soy milk and added it to my drinks, I am still a newbie, at that time the latte does not taste soy milk at all, there's this distinct taste of soy that you will not get from regular cow milk, well, I might be wrong. Well, I still had it and moved on.   Shorstack Blueberry Pancake with a side of Two eggs and Two Patties - These pancakes were huge, we shared and still took me a good hour to finish my part. The taste was okay, not too buttery, a little bit toasted at the bottom but that was okay I don't mind a little crunch. Eggs were cooked perfectly just add seasoning, and the patties were good too not salty at all.  Stuffed French Toast Combo with Two Eggs and Two Turkey Patties - French toast was delicious, it was not too sweet, the caramel complements everything in it.   Size - pancake and french toast were huge enough that you can share it.  Service - everyone was nice and attentive, but they look like they were on the edge or something.  It was a good brunch, I enjoyed the French toast the most. I would go back again and try something else.  p.s When I went to the bathroom one of the male crew members restock the tissue or something, next time I suggest announce or ask if someone is there, they will probably reply back since the bathroom is pretty small.

The coffee though, below average. I would skip on the coffee. Still over all 5 starts for service and food. I'd come back again very soon!

IHsOiDPC1rVOtuOS4VpuGw.text: Occasionally I will look up "Hot & New" restaurants and see if something piques my interest. I did just that and came across the BYC. I'm all for brunch food and gave it a try. I was glad to see that there's finally another brunch place at Town Square so my friends could finally meet me "halfway" between Henderson & Summerlin lol.  Helpful Tip: I'd recommend "joining the live waitlist" before heading there (through Yelp) which basically saves you a spot, but you must check in once you're there to confirm it. I did this and only waited 5 minutes at around 10am while there were other parties already waiting in line. It kinda works similar to how Supercuts/Great Clips does their mobile check-in. Very convenient.  Interior: The inside is deceivingly large and has a lot of tables that can accompany many 4-6 person parties. The outdoor patio has plenty of seating with umbrellas as well. There's live sports on the TVs and Vegas sports team art pieces on the walls.   Service/Server: The girl who sat us was really nice and told us that they opened about 12 days prior. Our server was Rusty and he was very friendly and gave us some good recommendations. He told us that the Broken Yolk was a chain from San Diego. Most everything we asked about on the menu he said was "bomb" so we had a little trouble kinda picking something to eat. When we finally got our food our waters were only filled the first time and never refilled after that. Our server checked on us once when we got our food, and then kinda disappeared until we were finished. My water cup was empty mid-meal and finally got refilled when we were already done eating (if that matters to some people).  Food:  We ended up ordering the (1) Chicken Fried Steak, (2) the Golden State Benedict, and (3) the crunchy French toast. It took about 20-25 min to finally get our food, which didn't really bother us because there were tv's to watch and time just passed by.  Each of their dishes were good but nothing to write home about.  (1) The CFS was a fair size and the gravy was just like I'd imagine it too, (nothing sweet like at Babystacks) and hash browns were just right. (2) The benedict we ordered had an overcooked poached egg and the yolk did not ooze out as we expected when cutting into it. (3) The crunchy French toast was just toast with corn flakes (atleast it tasted like just corn) on top drizzled with raspberry sauce. I was hoping there would be something to make me say "oh my gwodd" but I just ate it to eat it.   Albeit I'm not a food snob, but the food was acceptable. It tasted exactly as you would expect it to and there isn't a "wow" factor to it.  (Side note: Some of my favorite breakfast places to eat are Truffles & Bacon, Kitchen Table, DW Bistro, and Peg's, for comparison)  TL;DR  The interior is nice, the staff is friendly and service is okay for being a busy restaurant, food is a solid and a good fix and it tastes as you'd expect it to, but it was nothing spectacular. It is worth giving it a try with your friends/spouse/by yourself since it's Hot & New. I'll definitely come back to try other things and hopefully change my initial impressions.

MM291IUdMoqT9N96jTx6Dw.text: As a big fan of brunch I had to see what the Broken Yolk Cafe was all about.   This is a fantastic, easy to get to location on the south end of the World Famous Las Vegas Strip. There are plenty of tables, and arriving at 11am on a Tuesday it was only a few minutes to wait for a table for two.  The service was just a little bit slow as it seemed like our waitress was working quite a few tables, but what it lacked in speed it made up for in friendliness.  We started with the very appealing Mimosa and Bloody Mary Flights, both including 4 small varieties of each beverage. The Mimosas were delightful, and the Bloody Mary flight was good, but definitely included a lot of the alcoholic base. The morning cocktail menu was huge and definitely includes a little something for every alcoholic inclination.  The Tiki Toast was just as delicious as it looks in the photo, and surprisingly not too sweet. I was expecting an almost cake like texture but was pleased to find that it was a lot like a classic French Toast, just with a sweet bread instead of classic toast triangles.  The 'Momlette' as I called it was beautifully plated and tasted fresh, light, and fluffy. The hash browns were crispy and delicious.   Overall, The Broken Yolk Cafe lives up to the hype. I will definitely visit again!

H_OMQk-QhD6Si_atIj9KTA.text: Opened early April of 2019, but a known entity near San Diego for forty years, The Broken Yolk Cafe promised to capture Las Vegas' attention by offering "high quality, homemade Food in large portions," and a visit on Sunday showed the locally-owned space already very successful with a thirty-five minute wait despite windy weather at 11:00am.   An expanding concept with over thirty locations across six states, Sin City's first adjacent Total Wine at Town Square, it is after securing parking that guests approach a freshly built space capable of seating hundreds, though for a Restaurant so new and busy service is outstanding from the General Manager manning a digital waitlist to servers, bussers and even folks at the hostess stand.  Made (more) famous by an appearance on "Man vs Food," a twelve-Egg Omelet weighing in at nearly 4,000 calories earning a free T-shirt and comped check for those who finish under an hour, it is from a five page menu that those desiring more variety are invited to make choices, a full-bar offered from open to close daily also provided to tempt those who desire more than just Mimosas and Bloody Marys.  Priced competitive to Cracked Egg or Babystacks, and approximately half the cost of other Las Vegas Boulevard Breakfasts, it was with bottomless Coffee and Cocktails ranging $8-10 each that things got underway, "Suit & Thai" proving a bit bitter but certainly not lacking for Booze while "Chai Little One" and "Pucker Up Strawberry Lemonade" each acted as light sippers that compliment The Broken Yolk Cafe's fare nicely.  Opting to dine across three-courses, though in reality a check-average of approximately $18 will leave most over-sated, first bites came from extra-large Biscuits made from scratch with Butter, a gentle yeastiness amidst good rise attesting to quality with or without added Honey while Onion Rings and Hash Browns each cook up crispy as sides to a generous Fiesta Burrito smothered in Salsa and Sopes Benedict with Masa boats filled by seasoned Beef, carefully poached Eggs, housemade Ranchero Sauce and Avocado.  Focusing on items marked as "BYC Favorites," many of these recipes dating back four decades, it was after splitting a warm Blueberry Muffin that attention turned to a Belgian Waffle halved and stacked around Bacon, Egg and Cheese, a touch of Real Maple Syrup from home pushing flavor even further while a $10.95 Acai Bowl takes the "Superfood" in a new direction by offering it as tangy Sorbet surrounded by Fresh Berries, Coconut and Granola.    Not about to pass on French Toast and Pancakes, the latter offered solo or stacked in seven varieties including Gluten Free, those unafraid to indulge are highly encouraged to order swirled Cinna-Cakes drizzled with Vanilla Icing, and although "Crunchy French Toast" looks better on the menu than it does as plated the flavor is still excellent - though not quite on the level of Tiki Toast that perfectly suit's "The Ninth Island" with thick slices of Hawaiian Bread, Berries and Caramel Sauce.  FOUR STARS:  Although Henderson continues to show-up the West side in terms of Breakfast and Brunch, The Broken Yolk Cafe's recent arrival at Town Square gives those who don't like to cross The Strip something to be excited about. Imported from San Diego, but locally owned, consider this a great alternative to Egg & I or Cracked Egg with more creativity and better service at a similar price-point.

nbJGpWBBuptSQXyijMF8Ug.text: Classic comfortable friendly!  Came in on a Friday morning super busy so be prepared for a little wait. Parking is behind Fry's and is shared in a limited lot with a nail shop and Cafe Rio in front but they do have additional on the side.   Seating in booth were comfy. Bar seating by the entrance. Patio seating available.   ---Vegas Mule Cocktail-My guest ordered the Vegas Mule cocktail and said it was tasty but wasn't too strong. I guess he wanted more buzz in the morning.  ---Sope Benedict was nice and traditional flavors. Only reason why it's considered a benny is the poached egg but it was good the way it was meaning I could want it on a English Portion was great and I had it accompanied with beans. The beans complimented very well.  ---Caprese Benedict was also very traditional in expectation which made it comforting. Clean presentation and nice thick mozzarella  ---Stuffed Banana French Toast was a nice choice. The mascarpone in between slices paired with banana was perfect together. Very reminiscent of bananas foster with the flavors and we were a big fan of this sweet option.   We were checked on my management and our waitress made sure to check on us appropriately throughout the meal. I would like to try a few more of their signature dishes for sure.

241MlSrmhiwXXTMW5aHSbQ.text: We heard about this place during teacher appreciation week and decided to drive across town to go check it out. The biggest complaint I have and why they didn't get 5 stars, was because of the service. The service, I'd only give 2 stars to. We waited a good 15 minutes before anybody ever came up to us to ask us what we would like to drink. I don't feel that is acceptable. And even then, it wasn't our waiter, it was a guy that was cleaning off the tables around us. At the time we got there, it wasn't busy at all, only a few tables of people. There shouldn't have been a long wait for drinks. Eventually we got our drinks, (that also took awhile) and no one came back to take our orders. A waitress walking by, we stopped and mentioned that nobody has come to take our order and she was nice enough to take our orders. Throughout the time we were there, we still didn't get very good service. It's a shame that the service wasn't good. We had high hopes for this place since we took the tie to drive so far to check it out.  On a positive note...the food. The food was amazing! I saw a picture of the chicken and waffles benedict and knew I HAD to try it. Who combines these two amazing meals? They do and it is definitely worth it. They took two of my favorite foods and made them into one! I didn't however like the potatoes that came with them. They tasted bland, definitely needed some seasoning or something. My husband had the crunch french toast and that was also pretty delicious. We decided since it was Sunday, why not have a drink with our breakfast? I decided to try the mimosa flight because I love mimosas and it was actually pretty good. A good variety of flavors. They also have a bloody mary flight too, but my husband tried the bloody best instead because he wanted the one with the waffle and bacon in it. He said it was really good.

A4r2d__biIIvHPCKqb8Slg.text: My wife and I dined here this morning.   We had eaten at the Original Broken Yolk several times in San Diego over the years. We walked and and were not disappointed. The restaurant was bright and the staff was great.  We hereby claim Amanda as our forever server and Table 14 as our Reserved Table in her section. She was great. She took excellent care of us and checked on us periodically (not too often like in some places).  Ask for Amanda's section...you will be glad you did.

vzfLXpPGt0Mb9bWYQ8HU1A.text: We were really looking forward to trying this new breakfast restaurant out. It was Mother's Day and we expected a crowd and a wait. It was nice to have a message system to let us know where we were in the queue. It was also a great touch to have water, coffee and muffins outside for those waiting for a table. The great part is we only waited 16 minutes for a table.  Once inside we were seated and drink orders were taken. Our waitress was very nice and patient while we made our menu choices. I ordered the Country Skillet; my wife ordered the Original Benedict; my daughter had a short stack of pancakes with scrambled eggs and sausage; and my son have make your own omelet with fresh fruit. After she took our order we knew it would probably be awhile because it was so busy, but never thought we would have to wait as long as we did. It was about 45 minutes after our order was taken before we got our food. The couple next to us came in after us, ordered, ate and left long before we even got our meals. I think they had made ours then somehow forgot about it. You could kind of tell by the state of my wife's Eggs Benedict. The Hollandaise Sauce was all congealed on top like it had been sitting awhile, and there wasn't enough. Her eggs were also hard, as were mine, even though they were supposed to be over medium. My daughter's pancakes were dense to say the least (not at all light and fluffy) and she could only eat about a quarter of them. My Country Skillet was very good despite the eggs being too hard. My son's omelet was good and he enjoyed it.  Overall between the long wait for our food, the quality of the food and a higher than necessary price point it will be awhile before we come back, if at all. With all of the great 6-3 breakfast/lunch places in the area this will unfortunately be one of our last choices. We were just hoping for a better experience. Let's hope that they can get some of what appears to be growing pains out of the way soon, so that this place with a lot of potential can succeed.

UM7XDaFrp_p2Dp9_DSSFAw.text: I decided to check out Broken Yolk in Vegas a couple Sundays ago before driving back down home to san diego and overall, the whole experience was great! The hosts and servers were all friendly and the restaurant was clean; decor was super cute!  Portions are HUGE and totally share-able.    We ordered the Tiki Toast and the Mom Omelette (1 sweet and 1 savory dish)!   The Tiki toast was my absolute favorite - it's a french toast made from hawaiian bread topped with strawberries, coconuts and blueberries. The crunchiness of the outside had the perfect balance for the soft inside of the french toast. I highly recommend trying the Tiki Toast (it went perfect with my carmel latte).   Prices are very reasonable given the big portion size - will come back again! :P

yiQLwsM-bfmQH7-nyWN4iw.text: Best breakfast spot in Las Vegas. Authentic Mexican items on the menu that truly exceeded my expectations. Coming from California it's hard to find breakfast restaurants with good service, flavors and ambience.  The Broken Yolk has made it on my foodie list!

Y7WcGDktDEbIPPAPYqbt8g.text: Food was amazing! The Tiki French Toast was 10/10. Alicia (Las Vegas) was amazing very knowledgeable of the menu and nice as can be!

B1LgLOFRdN3x0iEW11QGLw.text: Great service! They aren't super busy before 9, good for us locals :)  Bringing my home San Diego to my new home in Vegas. Great eggs Benedict and tiki toast.  Thank you Crystal!

lqXHcHOH-WYRmFjBV50FEg.text: Came here around 25 minutes before closing and they were nice enough to serve us lunch.  First, our waitress Amanda was incredibly nice.  The place is sparkling clean as well.  Now to the food.  We had a turkey sandwich/ salad combo, crunchy French toast and a chicken wrap with sweet potato fries.  All of the food was excellent.  My daughter loved the turkey sandwich and the French toast was crispy but soft in the middle.  The fries were nice and hot.  Great place with great service and not a buffet

No free drink refills on many selections that are free at far better places. We will not be back. Maybe the ones elsewhere are better that they deserve 5 stars, this one, not so much. ownpGDRp6hLQFm5WloR5Ng.text: First time coming to this cafe and it was amazing. Jacqueli was our server and she was great. There was no wait time to be seated. Food and mimosa flight were awesome. Definitely come and try this place out . They have a variety of food to pick from

pf5y1UfRSZC1wUMLzgQBMw.text: Perfect location, a brand new restaurant extremely busy and a delicious menu. The service is good and friendly.

-bbMFTCoWG4HazLF5YHVTQ.text: Firstly, this is NOT about our server, Matthew. He was very nice and courteous. He unfortunately has to work with a manager and support staff that needs A LOT of help. My steak was ordered medium rare. It came, well,... well done would be giving the cooks some credit. It was toasted. Matthew took a look and said it was far from medium rare. He wanted to replace it. When it came, it was RAW! Not undercooked, RAW. It went back for try three. Came back and it was still raw. Matthew went to talk with the manager, Jim, who was hanging out at the front desk. Didn't come to talk to us. Matthew went to him again. Still no response. He looked at our table and then ducked into the kitchen. Matthew was apologetic. Why is a server needing to apologize for a manager than is willing to cash his paycheck, but throws his staff under the bus and ignore customer issues? Matthew ended taking it off the check since Jim was MIA and unwilling. Matthew asked we come back and ask for him so he could make up for it. Sorry Matthew, but I am hesitant since your boss, Jim, is still the guy running the show. If he can't address the most basic managerial tasks, I am fearful of another attempt where food, service and issues are left up to a person that is either incapable, or unwilling, to right wrongs.

9-szK9rEhaAEUgdzQ8YDfA.text: So excited they finally opened one in Vegas. I've been a huge fan of the original location in San Diego back in my college days and this new location doesn't disappoint. I had the California omelette and it was delicious. Bacon was crispy, eggs were the perfect texture, and the sour cream added a nice touch. I definitely will be back.

3d94vnFtr6jYIqo077kp7Q.text: It's such a wonderful restaurant! It has a pretty unique decoration and super delicious food. The servant there is friendly and respectful. The food quality is really selective too. I would go there often to enjoy my morning time.

Q1ZgHXEOf0qKqAo36EQ_mw.text: The food is amazing and customer service is top notch. They serve water in glass, which is a good touch. Rusty was very helpful and polite

eKfGZBSggaVtcipzU2P-Qg.text: Great Food! The 3 stars is for my experience. We were sat at the high table behind the two that are next to the bar. This is an extremely high traffic area. People were constantly saying excuse me as they walked past because they were bumping into me. A server asked me to stand up as I was eating so they could get by with a cart. For the sake of your customers experience as well as your employees, please think about reconsidering the placement of the table.

ji9051xyTtCNI79Qk7m-PQ.text: The service was great, our server gave us an amazing recommendation and we tried Hawaiian bread for the first time. The food came out fast and we enjoyed every single bite of it.

7leT9Rt8NGvpJ7OF5SSerw.text: The first time I ate at broken yolk was in Del Mar California. I am no stranger to really good breakfast restaurants as it is my favorite most important meal of the day. Some people like basic and simple breakfast cafes but what separates this cafe from the rest in the valley is they offer a wide variety of items that are different but very good quality. The orange juice is fresh and the food is really good. Service was excellent.

JM2Hyo5cdkxQgF64dpOUeQ.text: First time trying this place, more than likely the last. My wife and I wanted to try something new with the kids so last Saturday we got up early and headed down did something we rarely do (head to LV Blvd.). Upon arrival all was good there was, no wait and initially the staff seemed friendly. Then the food came.... let me start off by saying from the time we ordered to the time the food hit our table your talking less than 5 minutes. Already we were a little skeptical, being we ordered several dishes all of which would take sometime to cook fresh. The Huevos Rancheros, Golden State Benedict, Stuffed French toast and eggs and bacon for the baby. The time it took for them to serve our food suggested that virtually nothing was made to order. The Huevos Rancheros were luke-warm and that was accompanied with dry/hard rice and cold beans thankfully they heated up the tortillas (15 sec. in a microwave). The Stuffed French toast was cold which was understandable given the qty of filling however the French toast itself was just two pieces of bread lightly toasted with some cinnamon. My son joked that "technically it was stuffed toast, they forgot the French part". The bacon reminded me of the mass produced/drowning in grease bacon you get at a Carnival Cruise buffet. Finally we come to the Golden State Benedict, who out there has ever tried cold Hollandaise sauce? It's interesting, even more so when eaten with two almost Hard Boiled eggs underneath it. The cooks were kind enough to add a side that was supposed to be hashbrowns, sadly they more closely resembled and tasted like cold mashed potatoes. Like I said the staff seemed nice enough and if your looking for a breakfast that doesn't require actual cooking I wouldn't detour you. There were plenty of dinners eating yogurt and fruit bowls that looked pleased. It is obvious that most items are cooked in advance resulting in a sub par breakfast experience considering A. the location and B. the numerous amazing breakfast restaurants in the area. Las Vegas is a haven for amazing chefs/cooks young and old, a mecca of food Breakfast to Dinner. I truly hope my experience was a fluke one off

nZs0GgKAZnocMYHpr3nZaA.text: You HAVE to try this restaurant. If I could give it more than 5 stars I would. We recently had a 5 day stay in Vegas and ate here twice for breakfast/brunch. I recommend the mimosa flight. Great price.

HjCbzpP8DZdU-8bXYhBY7w.text: Absolutely phenomenal ALL the way around. Chelsea was our server and she was kind and very efficient. The food tasted perfect and was steaming hot fresh when it came to the table. It was a packed house this morning being Saturday and although my husband and I were totally fine with the wait, several servers came by apologizing for the wait and offered us fruit, muffins, and coffee cake which completely blew us away. You don't see that kind of etiquette and courtesy often anymore. We were only visiting Vegas so a bit bummed we don't have one in our hometown, but absolutely recommend 100%!! Thanks Broken Yolk!! Keep up your five star work!!

IH2kVyjsOHBU7lkdUJApnQ.text: Delicious and healthier than anything we found on the strip. They even had almond milk for lactose intolerant members of our group. Service was fast and friendly and accurate. The place just opened. The restroom was spotless and modern. Great place for kids.

MFQ66tBw0WLmEOA6SNW_kA.text: Delicious food ( got the crepe and fried chicken steak) portions were big and great for family style sharing . I was happy with the service, the food arrived quickly and waiter was attentive. Great place to stop by on the way back to LA from Vegas!

mStLW31opb0rWxvTkdVbZA.text: I've eaten at the broken yolk a half a dozen times now, and each time has gotten progressively worse than the last.  The first couple of times I went within a month of opening and everything was great.  Five stars.  However the past couple of visits the service has really plummeted.  The food is still really good, however it is very apparent that after the first month of being open they severely cut back on the number of servers.  There are very few servers to a full restaurant and as a result, the service suffers.    Again, the food, amazing. But be ready to wait. Multiple times, because they are busy and will forget.

9jwqsrBEfM3RPnrGuV3LMQ.text: This place is awesome for brunch. All their drinks were fun and yummy. I liked how they serve your drinks all pleasing to the eyes. I got a mimosa with orange juice and got my boyfriend the strawberry banana smoothie. Loved both of the drinks. I wanted to try the flight mimosa but I felt like it was too much for this early morning for me. For food we ordered the waffle sandwich and the breakfast tacos. Wow it was big portions and delicious! I would recommend sharing here because we didn't get to finish our meal, it was a lot of food but it was so yummy! The inside of the restaurant was vibrant and bright which created the perfect ambiance. We sat in the back booth and it was a delightful brunch. Highly recommend this place

NGzWzZ3A3bC4wh5mQCbEzA.text: Savory breakfast and lunch offerings offered at this hip little spot on Las Vegas Blvd, not to mention smack dab right next to Town Square where there is retail therapy and a fun gathering spot for friends and family. Location, Location, Location. Oh, and a nail place under construction next door. Breakfast and manicures with friends this is where you'll want to be. Now on to the food. I have only visited during breakfast and have sampled their chicken and waffles and California Omelette. Both were quite good. Each time I have dined here has been quite pleasant. The food is good, service attentive, pleasant ambiance and great location for locals and tourists. I will be back to sample more delectable meals hopefully very soon!

CNN9DRof0wMWGExw1ba8EQ.text: Had a pretty bad experience with the hostesses after a long wait. I have to say our waitress Adrianne was excellent. She definitely will excel with her customer service skills. Food was good not to SD standards but on the right track. See you soon Vegas!

WIza4QJmrncwjAP-yQZMNQ.text: Where do I start?! Our 20 min wait turned into a 45 min wait per the hostess they were kitchen issues. Once we received text that our table was almost ready we went to the hostess and she did not help but instead responded back by saying if you want to stand and have a staring contest I will win. RUDE!  Another guest was seated right away in the patio for open seating after she said their wasn't open seating.

7qulWtMnuv-Mzsmz9tBalQ.text: What a great addition to Town Square. Backed up to Vegas Blvd you'll find my new breakfast hangout. The Broken Yolk Cafe is deceptively large inside. Tons of room to bring your biggest groups to. The servers were crazy nice and very helpful. I think someone had spilled OJ under the table we were seated at. My shoes stuck to the floor like I was in a movie theater. I mentioned it to the server and he was over with a wet rag in a heartbeat to clean it up.  The table top was spotless, and 2 seconds later we had cups of some great tasting coffee hitting down in front of us. We ordered and the food was out crazy fast. I had a traditional 2 egg breakfast. The portions were hefty. Had the hash browns not been so perfectly cooked I might have been able to stop eating before my gut felt ready to pop.  The coffee was always hot and fresh and we left full and happy!  The menu has tons of great options that will be sure to cover even your pickiest eaters! Give it a try!

Free coffee and water as you wait as well as small blueberry muffins. Got the biscuits and gravy and it was delish and perfect for sharing. Everyone was happy with their meals and the manager came over and asked if we were happy with our meals and thanked us for our patronage. Would definitely try this place again when visiting. Close to the Town Square and pretty new. Loved the cozy, clean decor.

The food is well-prepared and tasty.  This comfortable and clean restaurant has a good variety of breakfast and brunch entrees that I found satisfying. You should have a very good time dining here.

The line can get pretty crazy, probably an avg of 30 min wait time, but it's just the 2 of us and we love to sit at the bar /counter and restaurants. I've tried the French toast and chorizo tacos and my husband has had the chicken-fried steak (his fave dish) both times.  The ambiance is bright and fun.

Delicious food and quick service. My cup was never empty.  Most importantly, we found out there's a local rewards program. Been here a few times and Alicia made sure we knew about it.   Can wait to come again.

hY3X4ONgRlsrm30m1avRRw.text: Great service. Nice variety in menu. The mimosa and Bloody Mary flights look amazing but I'll have to come back to try those when I'm not working. Love the bright decor with lots of natural light. Definitely ask for hash browns crispy or they come limp and underwhelming. Weekday lunch hour is pretty busy but the restaurant is large enough to have a decent table turnover time. They also have a great rewards card program. I'll definitely be back.

Zt_C9w1fQlX_Mg_kBdEWNw.text: Had the New York Steak and Eggs.  Comes with your choice of sides.  It was a top quality steak, cooked perfectly-absolutely delicious.  Highly recommended. All the other sides were also good, high quality, friendly service and good prices.   I will be back.  Well I just came back with a couple more people and we all ordered the New York steak and eggs.  This time it was horrible, total Flat Tire.  All three.  The steaks were bad cuts, only about 1/3 was edible and my medium rare was well done.  The place was super busy this time but that is not an excuse.  My 5 star just went down 2 stars because of this.  I imagine that this place might be hit or miss, but...  IDK give it a try, the first experience was great, try them when there not too busy??  Oh ya, even the sides were not that great this time, my refried beans were old and crusty, eggs were over cooked on one side and runny on the other side.  Just bad all around.  This was a Wednesday around 11 am.

jo52qRavYArvywiw24ytdg.text: 3.5  Decent experience here.    Newish to Vegas and I see its full of lots of breakfast restaurant which is a very good thing!   I had the two eggs breakfast and the eggs were relatively small...little disappointing.    I was able to get a substitute of french toast instead of regular toast which was very good.  Place puts a high emphasis on alcoholic drinks which I didn't get.  They also have healthier items on the menu, but judging by the girth of many of its customers, I don't think these were that popular.   I love breakfast and this was a decent choice.  I feel that First Watch and Snooze execute this concept better but they are not in this market.    Might give it another try.

FkWN0RipN7lZNjvMSl6AOg.text: Great place to have brunch! I had the classic eggs benedict and the cinne pancakes. The cinne pancakes were my favorite! The portions are huge so I would definitely share the pancakes with someone next time.

XTX_xm3aoOM5SF7zwYnuFQ.text: Absolutely fantastic experience. Jim, the manager, really helped guide us in despite the wait, part of the breaks of being THE spot for brunch here in town, in the hot summer heat ahead of us. It was hot outside but they made sure to really tend to the needs of those waiting their turn. Make sure to call ahead to get on the list!  The food was tremendous. I got the Border Benedict, which was exactly what I had hoped for. Reminded me of a Benicio del Porko I'd eaten elsewhere. This place is a perfect spot for a Saturday/Sunday brunch. No doubt one of the best new brunch spots in Las Vegas.  Perfect Sunday Funday before a Las Vegas Aces WNBA game just down the road...oh, and mimosas galore!

nIRAHHE7yxYKCy3cOx0XSQ.text: Came here with a large group with high Hope's, the reviews made it easy to pick. The food took FOREVER and not once did someone come to the table to explain or apologize even though the table behind us got an apology and an explanation from (Jackelyn, Manager).  We felt discriminated after the server (Mathew) and the Manager (Jacklyn) walked by us multiple times with out checking on us, I was ready to walk out. The food finally arrived after waiting for about an hour not including the 30 minute wait outside the restaurant. Honestly I don't see why pre cooked food took so long red rice, beans, machaca meat, soup you can literally just reheat that and the things that are made on the spot eggs, club sandwich... how long does that take to prep? It would've made a difference if the food was great but unfortunately it's just the hype because my soup came with the cabbage hanging over like a wet sock on the edge like they served it with a super soaker. The fries and club sandwich were good but the soup unfortunately was so salty that it was inedible, I poured some of the water I had as a drink to make it somewhat enjoyable. After telling Mathew he just took it away and offered to remove it from the check, normally at other places that's when the manager comes with their tail tucked between their legs with an apology but we got nothing! Please excuse my French but Jackelyn was a rude, racist bitch! My cousins onion rings were pale and under cooked and after she requested to be cooked more like an onion ring should feel and look, Jackelyn came with the rings and sarcastically asked "who ordered the extra crispy rings"... she seemed annoyed with our presence from the beginning. We left with out leaving a tip and I left a note that said "Shit food, Shit service" and as we walked out the manager and the rest of the clowns including a chunky girl with black shirt and glasses and Mathew looked out the window and laughed after sharing the note I left so I flicked a quarter towards the door so they can fetch!  Whoever owns this place, I would get rid of the racist cunts because bad food is one thing I can move on but feeling discriminated in a place that serves Mexican food is a joke!  Next time I'll just get Taco bell and deal with shits instead.

AYCI7ENzZVYVQH6s_eKMWA.text: As a San Diego native myself, it's exciting to see a "piece of home" make its way to your new home. Sparking nostalgic feels as if I was hanging by the Pier again while watching the waves.    We went on Mother's Day. It was about a 45 min wait (which is expected to be since it just opened and it's a holiday). So don't knock them down until everything gets ironed out. They use a phone-text feature to notify you when you're next, in case you wanted to leave and come back. I really like that they had a coffee and water station outside for people waiting and plenty of bench seats. A plus for customers. There were even little mini muffins! More points.    The ambiance and interior design are really nice. Very roomy, airy, and spacious. Large groups will not be an issue. Food was great! We had the El Fuego omelet and the Hash Skillet. Got a side of strawberry banana smoothie because it looked oh-so-refreshing. There are plenty of food choices from light and healthy down to heavy and food coma. Best known for their eggs benedicts, french toasts, and omelets. So look into that.   What's ideal about Broken Yolk's location at the corner of Town Square, is it's next to lots of upcoming restaurants and shops. In addition, it is minutes away from the airport! So for you visitors out there that are arriving in or leaving. Look no further, this place has breakfast and lunch, mimosas, and a full bar! Great way to start or end your Vegas vacation.

DnE-KSt68Fzmm1J0I-HCig.text: A hidden gem located in Townsquare shopping plaza. After reading the reviews and looking through the pictures, I knew that this place would be amazing for brunch with friends.  My friend and I arrived around 12:00 for a late brunch on Wednesday. I was surprised to see the dining area full. We were greeted and sat right away by the host. From acai bowls to burger, the Broken Yolk Cafe has all your typical breakfast and lunch favorites.  My friend ordered the steak and eggs which came with choice of either home fries, hash browns, fresh fruit, Mexican rice or refried beans. Then you get the option to pick from a biscuit, blueberry muffin, English muffin, tortillas or toast.  I decided to go with something different from my usual eggs and bacon. I went with the Baja breakfast tacos, which came with two corn tortillas filled with beef chorizo sausage, scrambled eggs, and avocado with homemade salsa and cotijia cheese. Mexican rice and black beans were served on the side, but since I am not a fan of beans I opted in for more rice. Overall, I am super impressed with this place. I highly recommend visiting if you're near or shopping at Townsquare.

HBfOxxgPLH_7u6NPQDW04g.text: Not what you would expect...  This place was recommended to me by yelp, and seeing its 4 star reputation, I had high expectations.   Walking in, I was greeting by an amazing host who was super friendly, wish I caught her name. I was then seated by an even likewise server. Everyone here is super friendly and actually seems like they want to work there.   Although, friendliness can only go so far. Even though we were in this positive atmosphere, the food was at most, iHop level. In actuality, I think I would've preferred iHop more.   While sitting down, two altercations erupted between a customer and waiter. One customer was asked to be carded multiple times for alcohol and then there was a big scene, alarming the guests. Right in that same minute, another woman's food was incorrect and it took them a long amount of time to get the correct food. Maybe it was just a bad day for the cooks, but those both set off alarms as a customer looking to try something new. The store manager had to be called to both these guests tables and had to de-escalate the situation.   All in all, had a lot of potential. Probably not coming back. Maybe if the food was re-amped and wasn't as stale, I would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sope Benedict

a0bVt0OZ-68dmAfNx3dfeg.text: Nice looking new breakfast spot located at Town Square, near Total Wine. We've been patiently awaiting the grand opening. Open for breakfast and lunch only. Whilst waiting to be seated, we were next to the bar and saw plenty of drinks beverages being prepared. The bloody looked delicious with bacon and a waffle on top.  We waited about 15 minutes and were seated at a booth.  Rusty was our server and was very cordial and pleasant. The mimosa flights looked tasty so ordered up one of those. The drinks weren't very cold so popped in an ice cube from our waters. Guess they were behind or overwhelmed today. Overall nice flight with orange, grapefruit, pomegranate and a mix of grapefruit and cranberry.  We perused the menu and they have plenty of items that sound tasty, like the crunchy French toast covered in corn flakes and the waffle sandwich. We chose the Hash skillet 5/5, home fried potatoes sauteed with corned beef hash, onions and peppers topped with cheddar cheese, eggs your way and bacon...YUM!  We also ordered the fiesta burrito and Rusty was quick to let us know how the burrito was: the fiesta burrito "is like a party in your mouth!" SOLD! Now we had to try it. Amazing and lived up to the party 5/5. Get extra salsa verde, the shredded beef burrito topped with fresh avocado was good to the last shared bite!  They had some sweet and savory selections, next time we will get one of each and share. Thank you for a very good brunch, can't wait to come back again.  Tip: they offer 10% Military / Veteran discount.

NGlauHV03FmzLgi9hOk3JQ.text: 3 1/2 stars. Cute restaurant, lots of options on the menu, but food was a little disappointing.  We went on a Sunday around 1pm and put ourselves on the online waiting list, so when we arrived, we only waited a few minutes. But I imagine the wait is much longer earlier in the day. There were a bunch of people waiting inside and outside.  We had the Tiki Toast, which was described as grilled Hawaiian sweet bread with fruit, coconut and caramel drizzle. I honestly couldn't tell it was sweet bread, and the texture was inconsistent - some parts were mushy, other parts dry. Not a lot of flavor, definitely needed syrup. We also ordered the John Wayne omelet (mushrooms, onions, cheese, topped with chili). It was good, not great, but I really liked the blueberry muffin that came with it.  Service was also just okay. Our server came over quickly after we sat down, but it was our first time and they have a large menu, so it took us a while to decide (maybe 7-8 minutes). Our server literally came by 3 times to take our order. We had our noses buried in the menu, so you'd think she'd see we weren't ready yet. We had to ask for drink refills and at the end of the meal, we waited about 10 minutes for her to pick up our credit card.   I'd probably go back to give them another chance, but I wouldn't wait more than a few minutes.

r1UzmW_IRi2zZ4Xt2iQxqw.text: Though we came on a hot summer Sunday and the wait was longer than expected, I was impressed with how their staff handled the rush! Faye who was the hostess outside in the scorching heat was so sweet and handled everyone's questions with ease. They set up a coffee station along with water and muffins for guests waiting outside. After 45 minutes, we were finally seated. The menu is huge with something for everyone. We also took advantage of the liquor menu. We got a bucket of champagne for mimosas with pineapple and orange mixers and I got a frozen Tipsy Joe which was absolutely delicious. For my meal I got the recommended fiesta burrito and it did not disappoint! I love green sauce so that made it even better. Despite being busy, food came out quickly. Great service and staff!

CvSww0jYaiJ5TE6T6Mlpfg.text: I didn't realize it, but it was their first weekend service. The Broken Yoke Cafe, located in the Town Square Shopping Area, off of S. Las Vegas Blvd, is a new eatery serving up some awesome food.  The space is very clean and has a modern flair.   It was Saturday when I visited and we waited about 45 minutes for 6 people.  But the line for a wait was hella long and I just thought of it as a popular spot...no biggie.  When we were finally sat, we were greeted by a very enthusiastic waitress. She took my sons order immediately cuz he had to leave.  We ordered after a few minutes and my sons order was on the table in about 15 minutes. That was awesome. Some of the food we ordered were Huevos con Chorizo, Chicken Fried Steak, Tuna Melt, French Toast with a side of bacon, and The Crunchy French Toast (combo with eggs and bacon). OMG. I HIGHLY recommend the Crunchy French Toast...bomb.   Partway through our service, I noticed the wait staff running around more than I usually notice while dining.  So I mentioned to our waitress "wow you guys are busy" and that's when she told me it was their opening weekend.   So to their credit, when you come visit this awesome place, be patient. The staff is still working out bugs and I'm sure the rough edges will smooth out. I highly recommend this place for brunch or whatever tickles your fancy.

DOd9dKSZv1cm2-NA361gBg.text: Welcome to Las Vegas Broken Yolk!!!  This location was dishing out food very quickly, and the food came out super fresh.  The kitchen staff is efficient and is dishing out some delicious food.   I highly suggest the country fried steak -- it will give any other breakfast place in Las Vegas a run for it's money.  At $11, it's a hell of a steal for the huge chicken fried steak, fresh and crispy hash browns, egg-cellently cooked eggs (I mean, it is called broken yolk!) and a really good Blueberry muffin.  The country fried gravy sauce is the boss! Soooo Good - I'm drooling thinking about it right now.  I also highly suggest getting some of their mixed drinks.  The prices are reasonable and they're using top shelf alcohol.  They keep them nice and strong too.  Other suggestions are:  the Tiki Toast (a great finisher for the table.  Crispy, sweet, airy, oh man...)  The Chilaquiles: The chips remain pretty crispy and are covered in delicious salsa and cheese.  I'm not sure what they do to their beans and rice, but they would give mexican restaurants a run for their money.    The NoName Omelette was very tasty as well.  Light, but packed with the ingredients and my favorite - bacon.  The eggs are not overcooked, which is a typical issue with omelettes at other places.  This place knows their eggs!  If you're not in the alcoholic mood, the orange juice is freshly squeezed and tastes like you got it at a farmers market.  Pomegranate juice is also an excellent hangover cure.  The service was excellent as well.  My party had Rusty, and he was always checking in on us and making sure that our drinks were never empty.  He was always very prompt in making sure that we got our stuff and was very attentive.  He had great knowledge of the menu as well.  Thanks Rusty!  Stop by and try Broken Yolk.  You will not be disappointed! One of my favorite places for breakfast.

11bCumGo3JdXUFvcMhl8lg.text: Visiting from California for the week and we stopped here for breakfast. When we got here the hostess told us 15-20 minutes for a table for two. This was confusing because there was an entire wall of open booths as well as taller tables available for parties of two. We gave our phone number and sat to wait.   Once we got seated, our server Matthew came over with two waters in his hand. We had been sitting long enough to check out the menu and decide what we wanted to order. We ordered our food and then he asked us if we wanted anything else to drink. We ordered a Tipsy Joe to share between the two of us, one of the frozen coffee cocktails I assume? We never got it. He checked both of our ID's and made small talk about the taste of the drink. He had the handheld device in his hand putting in our orders so I'm confused where he went wrong. After he put everything in, or so we thought, he walked away and was not to be seen again until much after our food had been delivered.   Our food came out, and there was no quality check or water refills. We still didn't have our drink. Then an older gentleman in glasses and a button up, assuming the manager, brought over two mimosa flights. We didn't order mimosa flights. The man kept saying "13? For table 13?" To Matthew. On our check, it did say table 13. Matthew told the man that it was so funny, someone must have just put in those drinks under his number and our table. He's right, hilarious. NOT. How did someone else ring in two mimosa flights for his table? Under his number? When he had the handheld device in front of him? Unlikely. After we refused the mimosa flights, more time went by before Matthew finally came by to ask us what drink we ordered. (Because he never put it in!) Again I would like to bring up the fact that he had the handheld POS in front of him at the table when we ordered.   The food wasn't bad. It could have been served hotter but otherwise it tasted good. Wasn't spectacular but it wasn't awful. After we had finished eating, we sat for about ten minutes looking for Matthew with him nowhere in sight. When he appeared again, he ignored us and sat to chat with the table next to us. He was there for 5 minutes while we were still waiting for boxes and a check. A bus boy noticed we looked ready to go and he came to clear our plates and give us the boxes we needed. We had to ask him for our check as well. He asked who the server was.   Matthew FINALLY brought the check to us. He looked it over before he set it down and then confirmed it was ours. This is important because the check given to us still had a mimosa flight on it. He walked back to the other table to chat them up again and we were left waiting AGAIN to tell him the check was wrong. When I brought it up to him about the mimosa flight, he insisted someone else put it there. Regardless of who put it there, while it's incredibly unlikely that someone else did, it was still on our check that he looked over before dropping off. When he had to fix it, he brought back the handheld POS and told us our new total and then made a joke about how expensive the mimosa flights are. So I am sure he can understand why we didn't want that on our check ESPECIALLY because we didn't order or receive them.   Overall, the restaurant was nice and clean. The hostess with the ginger hair and the French braids super friendly and doing a great job by herself. Otherwise, Matthew's service was slow and lackluster. We had high hopes for this place. Even though I am from out of town, we will not be back.

C7IwjgC3YvvilCSpoGtq-g.text: This was an experience. At first it wasn't bad though the server only came around once. Once our food and drinks came out it looked fine but in reality it wasn't. She came back with a new one but in this one there was food particles and residue on the inside of the cup. It was disgusting and not okay. V7UFoSWcTp6vQUNkcFOOhA.text: I've been to a handful of the other locations in SoCal, and this location is by far the best one yet (Glendora comes in at a close second, though)!   We came here on a Monday for a late breakfast with a large party, and they were able to accommodate us pretty quickly. Got a few dessert dishes to share -- cinnacake (cinnamon pancakes) & Nutella crepes-- and a waffle sandwich for myself, & he got the chilaquiles (he said it was the best he's ever had).  Cinnamon pancakes were definitely my favorite! Super soft & fluffy with the perfect amount of cinnamon. The waffle sandwich was also quite tasty-- eggs were fluffy & bacon had just the right amount of crisp.   This will definitely be my go-to breakfast for off-strip Vegas in the future!

yE1viU8-BmKtMmpKFNxrlQ.text: Pricey for what it is. (Breakfast for two (no booze)came to over $30) Mediocre food and service. Nothing awful, but nothing great.  I asked for a breakfast burrito with no bacon. We even had a conversation about why. Burrito arrives with bacon anyway. The rice and beans tasted like they were out of a box. Not saying that they were,  but they sure tasted like it.   Our water glasses were never refilled.  The place has a nice clean design with lots of natural lighting. But all those reflective surfaces also make it loud. A crying child on the other side of the restaurant made it almost impossible to have a conversation.

T9KpTzIgOFjkGDwfeJ8IOQ.text: The food and service was excellent. Congratulations to the hard working team and the new location. I5MgnMOFzMtwC9KZyuuzeA.text: 5. Why were the eggs running so fast? They were afraid of being beaten!   Ok sorry I just had too! Haha! Anyhow, after 3 nights in Vegas hubby and I were on our way out of Sin City until we realized omg we haven't eaten! Located just a couple of miles down from the strip we decided to stop by. This was just last month in August  When we first arrived to the place there was already a good amount of people there. The decor was all so very cute and the atmosphere was very pleasant. Our server was upbeat and welcoming! We were immediately seated, given our menu and offered "mimosas" if that's not a great way to start I don't know what is!   I ordered the no name omelette which consisted of bacon, avocado, mushroom, onions, while hubby got a skillet. My eggs tasted amazing along with my fresh avocado! Nothing was over cooked and my hash browns were nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside! Hubby and I were really impressed with overall quality and quantity and not to mention a great price!   If we stop in Vegas we will definitely be back for breakfast! If you want somewhere off the strip or even if you are a local check out this place!

d8tbUPFq-dBEHS9BOTnR7g.text: The Broken Yolk Cafe is like that person you meet a little later in life but realize was always meant to be one of your very best friends: inviting, comforting, and familiar - yet unlike anyone else you've ever met before.  This new-ish brunch spot amidst the hustle and bustle of Town Square makes for the perfect place to indulge in a flight of mimosas alongside an omelet and catch up with your social circle or prep for some midday shopping. Conveniently located right off the southern end of Las Vegas Blvd within my favorite local shopping complex, Broken Yolk offers a wide selection of delicious eats and beverages suitable for parties of all kinds, whether you're day-drinking or out for lunch with the fam.   A note to the gluten-sensitive - you're in luck. The menu even includes gluten-free pancakes, a rare luxury that I hope turns out deliciously for you!  As for my recommendations? Do yourself a solid and indulge in the Nutella Crepes with both bananas AND strawberries with an Arnold Palmer on the side.

CBMYZtzoItDRFXEX1Z6_Yg.text: Love this place. This is an establishment that we frequent when we visit San Diego and wr are so glad that it opened here in Vegas. It is located at Town Square behind Fry's and when we came on a Monday morning, we were greeted with enthusiasm and vigorous smiles.  Cade, our host was very sweet and helpful. He told us that they opened about two months ago and he is glad that we visited them that day.  The food is good and delicious and made fresh, as they always do based on past visits, albeit in San Diego. They also serve cocktails early in the morning which is an added bonus.  I recommend this breakfast place to locals and visitors alike. It's close to the Airport so stop here first as soon as you land! Enjoy!!

HcwVJIUCuqWwUMpixWWvrw.text: Came here for an early lunch one Sunday and the line was huge. Luckily they have an ipad that you can check into and they text you when you're table is ready. That way, you don't have to stand there and wait. You can go around exploring Town Square and do some shopping. Or you could be like us and walk on over to Total Wine to look at their selection of beer   The Broken Yolk came from San Diego and they have items on the menu that are influenced by flavors from the border, which makes them really unique.   Except, my party usually has a tough time deciding on what they want to eat so it took a while. I ended up getting their crunchy french toast, which is french toast with cereal flakes on the outside. My husband went with their blueberry pancakes and my friend got the border benedict and belgian waffle.  The food didn't take long despite how busy and packed they were. My french toast was actually very tasty. I really like the addition of the cereal flakes, which give it a contrast in texture. My husband's pancakes were okay -- I'm not a fan of pancakes so I actually did not have an opinion. I tried some of the meat on my friend's benedict and I actually really liked the flavor/seasoning of it. The waffle was a waffle.   Overall, good food. Some of it is pricier than it should be but that's a lot of breakfast/brunch places so it's normal. Nice flavors and unique items. I wouldn't mind coming back to try some other things on the menu.   TIP: Make sure your waiter/waitress repeats your order back to you. My husband had wanted the full stack but the waitress only heard short stack. At least the bill was correct. Just double check before your server leaves the table!

They noticed that no one has asked for waters or menus after like 5 minutes but that's okay, not the longest I had to wait for someone. They were very apologetic and very nice though.   We ordered and shared the hash skillet and cinna-cakes. The has skillet was very good, I love corned beef! The only reason knocking down a star is because of the cinna-cakes. Zo93lHJ9r_nNmGj5uZBR0w.text: Came here for brunch one day as best friend had mentioned this place opening in Town Square by Total Wine (alchy...). Originally we had planned to go to Truffles and Bacon but decided against it because of the possibility of a dish being too sweet. LOL.   I had arrived around 11AM and had saw the line out the door, reaching half way across the building, towards Cafe Rio. Omg. I parked and stood in line. A friend and her husband had came out and said i needed to check in. So I did, 10 minutes later. Oops? Didn't get an approximate wait time but saw on the tablet it was 60-75 minutes. With the text system, it just says it will contact you when table is ready. We ended up walking to Total Wine (....alchys....) to kill time. About 30 minutes later, got a text stating table was ready. Walked in and was sat almost immediately.   As always, we have decision issues. LOL Took a while to decide what to get. Waitress had left from our indecisiveness to help another table real quick before coming back to us to take our order.  I had ordered the "Border Benedict" which was poached eggs and seasoned carne asada atop two sweet corn cakes, smothered in homemade poblano sauce  Overall, this was pretty good. The poached eggs were nicely cooked, mildly more than I expected though. The carne asada was decent. Good flavor. The poblano sauce was mild but had a nice flavor. Unfortunately, the two sweet corn cakes were SUPER HARD and DRY. I'm ok with corn bread or similar, when its fresh and softer, but this was as hard as a rock. It was hard to even cut through with a knife.   Also had ordered a "Belgian Waffle" plain w/ powdered sugar and whipped butter  This Belgian waffle was pretty decent ! I was afraid it was going to be dense. I've seen some places use like a thick ball squished into the waffle maker but this was nothing like that. Crispy outside. Nice and light on the inside. Mild amount of powdered sugar and the whipped butter was nice and light as well. Nice side to share. Probably one of the better waffles i've had in a long while !  Friends had ordered a "Blueberry Short Stack" and "Crunchy French Toast"   The "Crunchy French Toast" includes three extra thick slices of bread rolled in crunchy frosted flakes, sprinkled w/ sliced almonds, raspberries, and powdered sugar, topped w/ whipped cream and a raspberry drizzle  This was quite interesting. Large portion. The frosted flakes and almonds adds a nice texture and flavor to it all. It was a bit sweet, but not bad. Would be great with a cup of coffee HEHE   Blueberry pancakes.... well... its pancakes... i can't say much about it cuz most pancakes are dead to me. LOL   Overall, pretty decent place. Despite the long line, the wait wasn't bad. The location is pretty spacious with some outdoor seating too. Would like to come back to try other things
