Vkdzcsl_qVba6bB2b3GyEQ.text: Let's meet for brunch here at the Broken Yolk Cafe! Don't worry I won't break the yolks till you get here!!  The Broken Yolk is the newest flavor to be added to the collection of chaos here at Town Square. This is not your typical mall. It's more a menagerie of stores that are made popular by those of us whom frequent this area and call it home for shopping; both local and tourist alike.   Let's dive right into the menu, so it's a breakfast place. Why should I wait in line to eat at this place? What makes it so special? I could go to Denny's right! Wrong, but it is America; so if it's Denny's you crave by all means. If not then listen up for the why? Their might be a surprise quiz at the end. You want to get an A, Right ?! Unique and quirky names grace the covers of this sacred document that we will cover called the menu. First thing that we start with being brunch or breakfast is the coffee! Plus this cafe is in a few states with some built of following, check google for more information.  Coffee is easy and essential, so already the Broken Yolk rates high on my meter with such spins on the Caramel Macchiato with their dirty Caramel Macchiato. The Caramel Messy Macchiato comes hot or iced with all the dirtiness one would expect with extra caramel and whip flavor. The espresso is strong and that messy Macchiato looks just like that of the picture too! Wow !!  If it's breakfast with that newest simplicities of healthiness then this is the perfect place. All the calorie counts are listed on the menu very clearly. The menu is in full color with most of the food pictured in clear and concise wording. The menu especially breakfast is the largest portion of their menu. The menu is organized very throughly and planned beautifully. The names of some of the menu items. Let's pick John Wayne which is an Omelet which the Duke, would probably of eaten in his days here on Earth. The Dukes omelet has onion, cheese, mushrooms, and chili.   Anything one could be craving for breakfast can be attained here. Pancakes, waffles, French toast, crepes, biscuits and gravy!! Wow the list continues until breakfast coma sets in. I'm loving the spin and class that is being brought back to breakfast by the cafe here. Both indoor and outdoor seating exist in this little cafe. The cafe is truly "cafe" size too! If you are dining here on a Sunday usually their is an over an hour wait; at least! Unless you want to dine in the patio area which is covered by Umbrellas but has no air conditioning. It's beautiful to sit either outside or inside. While I prefer the outdoors and then you can enjoy your meal with less noise and other patrons so close in proximity to one another. Plus mimosas taste best on the patio!  The staff here are so amazing as they move through their days all is grand as they work. The boss and owner whom calls this business his home makes his rounds to ensure that the customers are all fairing well with their food choices. This place is so great that employees that work here eat here when not working. The energy and empowerment of the staff is phenomenal and so appreciated as I eat !  Now everything that I have had here has been amazing. Truly each item on the menu that I try continues to amaze and surprise. The crepes are fab and we ordered them with strawberries of course, with the other choice being banana. The strawberries are placed and packed inside of the crepe too. Then to top it off Nutella is drizzled over the top. What a way to have breakfast? Fresh strawberry crepes!!

amXGxiuHkBnfPNvVYIvmxg.text: All I can say is YUM. The broken yolk has so many options to choose from for breakfast and they definitely have their own twist on everything. I loved the savory crepes I ordered, it has a Mexican twist because of the green sauce which was a good bite, very flavorful. I loved the filling; shredded chicken, jack cheese and corn. It was simple but delicious. My bf got the ranchero skillet and the breakfast tacos. He said both were delicious and the prevention was definitely beautiful. I wish the Arnold Palmer was a little sweet but it was natural and that's what counts. From the order being put in to the food coming out, was about a 15-20 minute gap which wasn't bad for a early Sunday. I'll be back!

DxVrAkMdc6hr4AyhLtI5Yg.text: On the way to Vegas, the hubs said that he found a breakfast place we can try out. The restaurant got its start in San Diego, and decided to bring their success (and delicious offerings) to LV.  The restaurant is about 15 minutes away from the strip, and it's located in a large commercial area, so there's PLENTY of parking. The restaurant itself is pretty big too.  The hubs had a Chicken Fried Steak with eggs and hash browns. Instead of their usual toast offerings, he asked for biscuits with a side of gravy (see why I said "YES"?). The biscuits were HUGE! They were freshly baked and so soft. The hubs seemed to enjoy the rest of the dish, but the biscuits definitely overshadowed everything else. We were, however, a bit disappointed with the gravy. We're both all for thick, country gravy, but this gravy looked like it had been sitting for a bit - it was so thick (almost clunky) that instead of drenching the biscuit and complimenting it with unctuous flavors, it kind of just plopped on top of the biscuits and just... kinda... sat there. I would have been put off by it, but I was too busy enjoying my selection.  I ordered the Chicken and Waffles Benedict and the Bloody Maria. The waffles were definitely not as crisp as I would have liked them, but they're topped with chicken tenders and poached eggs. The eggs were a TAAAAAAD bit over, but overall, the dish was pretty delish~ The Bloody Maria was absolutely delicious as well - I told the hubs that the next time we're there, I'll have to try one of the other options they offer for Bloody Marys.   Or maybe I'll get the flight...  Then order my favorite for the meal.

We ordered the fiesta burrito,  having fresh avocado helps anything taste better. I ordered the bloody Mary sampler, which just made the meal worse, but it was my fault for expecting more than what anybody that can Google can make at home.(15 bucks down the drain)  My wife ordered the border benidict, too sweet and dry, it looked nice. She ordered the Carmel iced coffee latte, they should have just given us a cup water and Carmel on the side( I recommend just go to Starbucks instead)  My son ordered the pancakes, really hard to mess up chocolate chip pancakes.

BAuNgLZ3xsRebTUU_nFc0g.text: I'm from San Diego and whenever my fiance and I would visit my family down there, we would go to Broken Yolk for breakfast. They make the best Benedict's. 2hubQpUtKJ8E0JiY6QTxYw.text: Broken Yolk is going to be my new go-to brunch place in Vegas! It is located conveniently next to Town Square in the same complex as Total Wine and Fry's Electronics.  So many brunch spots in Vegas feel crowded and claustrophobic but even though Broken Yolk was busy, I felt like I had space to breathe. There's plenty of natural light as well as tasteful decorations and TVs that were playing the Masters during my visit.  My waiter was Rusty and he provided excellent service! He was attentive and immediately provided my table with waters but still gave us plenty of time to order. He was also prepared with recommendations and had answers to all of our questions as well.  I got the American breakfast (eggs, toast, hash browns, sausage) and let me tell you, the hash browns especially were EXCELLENT! The real star of my meal was the mimosa flight though. It came with four different mimosas (Orange, grapefruit, apple, cranberry) for $12. I will be coming back for that bad boy asap! I also ordered a spiked strawberry lemonade which was delicious!  Already planning my next visit!

Bianca was our waitress and she was so sweet and attentive.  This restaurant will definitely be on our breakfast list!  We are so happy we made the decision to give them a try, a great way to end our trip with a delicious meal!  Thank you!

VSCIxPczDvCdgUiOFeFDRg.text: Really amazing food for a price that's really worth it. This went above and beyond our expectations! Really great place, warm, welcoming and cozy! Also, they have a really friendly servers! I wouldn't mind a second round of meal and eating breakfast here again.

idjJCeNiXRRxZgYnFO_r0g.text: First off I want to say the greeter was very friendly.  The food itself was mediocre at most.   We ordered the Chicken Fried Steak with hash brown and a side with a blueberry muffin, the portion size was huge but didn't help with the flavor as there was none. My wife had the S.B.A and she said it was good, but nothing special. We were hoping to enjoy the Crunchy French Toast but our waiter forgot to enter it in, she even came to us and said it's at very big possibility that I never put in the order. Well thanks for letting us know Amanda that you forgot to place the order instead of apologizing. she came back at us with well to be honest your table isn't really my table! Then walked away. Thanks Amanda for making our first time and last time memorable.

WcDtbFVPf2rLGevb9hz6_A.text: I've been looking forward to going to this location. I've been to this restaurant in San Diego many times lots of years ago. It didn't disappoint! Mom and I had Bloody Marys to start. I had the No Name omelette and she had the Greek salad. The hash browns were delicious too. We went during the week and were able to get seated and served right away. Parking wasn't the best. Had to park closer to Total Wine because the little lot by the restaurant was all full. Will be back!

-Est_QH-oPvtLeMNnSnOhw.text: New location and staff. Impressed with location, building, wait staff and coffee. We tried it on a Saturday morning. Not at all busy when we arrived.   Lots of groups arrived shortly after. It was EDC weekend. Food arrived cold. Wait staff took it back and Microwaved it instead of making a new plate. Once our food arrived the waitress was MIA. We had to ask for our check.  Not really sure if I'd try it again. Disappointed since our weekend mornings are usually spent dining out and a new place in the rotation is always a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ranchero Skillet

f7Lsbmwe_A6aUGcp92q72w.text: This place has the best cinnamon pancakes... it's like if IHOP and Cinnabon had a baby... they are so good that we order them as a breakfast appetizer because why should appetizers just be for dinner?!?  The service is great, it's trendy and cute and any breakfast joint that has a bar, has my vote! The mimosa my friend ordered was correctly proportional to her expectations (I guess more alcohol less juice?)  I would recommend this place to everyone and I plan on going back. It was easy to get to and parking wasn't terrible.

NFDFriVYQIvWq2-tavpfDw.text: Food and service was great. Awesome menu with lots to choose from. Definitely will return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiki Toast, eggs and bacon
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jr. Strawberry Smoothie

LvwvEEX581AkwlTpahnpww.text: Clean comfortable booths with simple yet well appointed decor. The breakfast menu had lots of choices. Rusty was our server and he was top notch! Food portions were large and was so delicious! Highly recommend this place for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

wA1e_4CnpLACBAfj-MAy6w.text: Second time eating at one of their restaurants. First time in CA and now here in Vegas. Food isn't bad overall but it pricey for what you get. I also expect a breakfast place to be able to make toast. They sent me out toast twice and both times it had zero browning and was soggy. I might have well had buttered stale bread. The picture is of the second attempt. May sound stupid but I feel the simple things are what show how good a restaurant is. Don't think I will be coming back as there are better breakfast places in Vegas that are much cheaper as well. Hope the tourist enjoy wasting their money.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YQHETdWwVs_CfX9LpoJX6w.text: I first came here a few months after the opening and the food was great but just recently I went there with my fiance and my sister and found several strands of hair in my food, I was so disgusted that I didn't want to order anything else, my fiance and my sister said their food tasted very bland and dry as well. I looked over at the cooks and noticed they were not wearing hair nets which I highly recommend that they do. I also went to the bathroom and there was no soap available to wash my hands which means more than likely that the employees are not washing their hands properly which is another deep concern. I am writing this review to make others aware of the health and safety of this restaurant so that no one gets sick, the employees seem nice and I just hope that management can resolve these issues quickly.

1FfYn-k-91SY7V4OpENFXQ.text: Wanted breakfast before heading to the airport. The service was fast and Alicia was fabulous. The ford was very good. I had the no name omelette with bacon and avocado. Yum. I will come back for sure when i come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s left of my No Name omelette.

K6wvIeOMVz_xZ07YTTtmPA.text: I found my new favorite breakfast spot! Super cool to find out that the original is in my home town in San Diego. My mom and I stopped in after craving some late breakfast after some shopping at town square. Amanda was super helpful and attentive. Thank you for being so kind and knowledgeable!! As for the food, IMPECCABLE. I didn't even have time to take a photo of our food because we both starting digging in as soon as it got to the table. The cinnamon bun pancakes are unbelievable. Definitely give this place a shot if you love flavorful breakfast/lunch food!

XZwFU7Zk-716hU5WlwXJeg.text: Fun environment! Dropped by on a family trip and apparently broken yolk is one of the most popular brunch spots in Vegas according to the front desk at ceasars, so we checked it out! Did not disappoint! I ordered the crunchy French toast and my brother ordered the border Benedict! This is our new favorite place! We live close to Glendora so look forward to checking out that location too!

wm8ZDWvyqoxr_PizVglLag.text: I was so excited to try out this new restaurant and come to find out it was just as amazing as it looked online we had ordered the Mimosa boat it was incredible so good definitely will get you a little tipsy, all the food was amazing definitely be coming back the wait wasn't long at all on a busy Friday,staff was amazingly sweet and nice over all great experience

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9B0mHIk5zArLidsBbpzI2w.text: What do you look for in a breakfast joint? Good food, great service, large portions and a great price right?   Well say no more. New to the Las Vegas area a Southern California staple-mark. Do your self a favor. Drop in. If you don't like the wait. Call ahead for a 30 minute call ahead to be placed on the seating list. I mean 30 minutes in Vegas? You can live on the other side of town and show up to a table waiting on you! It's also very helpful on weekends. If not. Show up. Have a Mimosa or Bloody Mary flight at the full service bar while you wait. Or sample a good old fashioned draft beer.   When you get to your seat bring an appetite! Portions aren't here for the unhungry. It's like your grandmother throwing down. Always makes sure your full before you leave. The food is amazing.  Plus, the service. Can't beat it. Super friendly, respectful and super accommodating. They really have a dialed in program here. If the first meal of your day is truly your most important. You owe yourself a trip here.

BhyqQS27ngfs5yLph_XZaw.text: California burrito is incredible! I went on a girls date here and it was so worth the wait. The food was exactly what we were looking for and even the coffee was good! I will be visiting again to try the mimosas!

r-UPbfr2ehvghfWmZFvIsw.text: Terrible service. Also terrible food. Asked to see a table of fours ID's 3 times. Each time she asked she would spend 10 minutes looking and asking questions. After 30 minutes we finally got our drinks.. the food was mediocre and the people next to us also complained about our waiter.

kRmg3inVpHQzAX9yXUMG_w.text: Came here for breakfast    ! Had a wonderful time with our server CHELSEA ! She was amazing and welcomed us with open arms. The selection for anything and everything you want to eat, our eyes were bigger then our stomach.  Ate the Golden State Benedict!The Best . Shoutout to all the staff for working with a smile on their face . Love coming here and will be back for more.

kEuNnnrIaYoW4OiHP-D5hw.text: Shoutout to Randy and his staff at the Broken Yolk Cafe. Came in this morning for breakfast and we had a wonderful time. Their menus are super cute. I enjoyed an iced mocha latte from their coffee bar and it was fantastic. We also had the hash skillet which tasted great.   Amanda was our waitress and she was excellent. She is super down to earth and great at her job. Jim was also super cool! Honestly, all of their food look delicious. I don't think you could go wrong with anything at this restaurant as everything looks on point.

l0I15QAHK29z1pfSVZocGw.text: Everyone enjoyed their meals. We all agreed we'd be back. The decor is clean and cute. While very busy, they worked hard to get people sat quickly. We never felt rushed once seated either. The full bar is a plus, but the best part was the friendly staff.

fYA0E3nAQ4iW6e9JlVz0SA.text: I have to say this place is by far the best breakfast restaurant I have been to. I loved the food and the fast friendly customer service so much I went twice in one week. The only thing that was disappointing was that they didn't seem to have a server serving outside during business hours. Overall the place was great and the food is awesome.

PcNQF0jB2sO9gqBaa8HrVg.text: After a long wait server was on point very helpful and wow the food is a lot.  Omelet is enought for 3 people.  I would recommend.  Great menu of drinks and food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place is empty.  Should not have to wait 10 plus minutes for someone to come.

VRj8RqPZ85cSQ5Vhbk6d9A.text: This is as good as it gets for breakfast. Wide variety of choices and everything is fresh, yum, and delicious! If you have Celiac, you can convert any pancake, waffle, French toast, or crepe into gluten free.

_cYt_ALJZEeyXNcS6X7cqQ.text: We order the crunchy French toast, as well as the monte cristo. They were both delicious. The French toast had a nice crunch to it and the monte cristo was very flavorful.

cru3zWfybuRFIhQNXIwsJg.text: In town for a few days and found this new breakfast/brunch restaurant.  Service was very friendly and on point!! Thank-you Janean!!  Atmosphere was warm and fun!! Food was delicious!!   Chicken fried steak was very flavorful and the gravy was excellent!!  Cinnamon pancakes were good.. Short stack more than enough.  Made it a meal with two eggs and bacon.  Crunchy French Toast also another winner!! BUCKET OF BUBBLES!!  A must do if you like mimosas!!  Highly recommend the Broken Yolk Cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs..  Eggsalent

W0sd8yoobF5LCNuYDnWUrw.text: New spot however still great food and service. I am sad I could not give 5 stars. My water glass and coffee mug were empty for a very long time. Otherwise a good meal for the money.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surprise!!
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the eggs! They have toys inside!!

xkn1YhIgB5UHlq-WQieSsQ.text: Holy breakfast mimosa flight!  That's a saying right? This place was great. Everything from service (thank you Jon) to management, cleanliness and food it was all great! Clean bathrooms, plenty of seating, and good service all made this experience stand up to the broken yolk reputation. We did have to wait outside on a hot July day BUT they offer complimentary fruit infused water as well as coffee so it makes the wait super bearable. They put you on a waitlist via text and I was surprised to see when I checked in that it transferred to show in my yelp acct which was neat to be able to track our wait. I ordered steak and eggs and when my steak was a little redder than I liked I attempted to enjoy but I just couldn't. When I told my waiter he was beyond accommodating and the manager made sure he was right there to deliver my new plate. My whole dish was delicious and it's definitely not worth knocking down any stars. I also got to try the cinna cakes! I personally couldn't have eaten them by myself, they are super rich but they were delicious to try. As well as the.... I'm not sure what it's called...Banana Marscapone french toast, it was amazing! Good enough that I would order next time. I watched Jim make sure his team was picking up trash and making sure things were running great. Keep up the good work Jim and team, we will be back for sure!

E-D_IbF504k4CDlghPyXCA.text: My wife wanted to try this new restaurant out because of the reviews. We missed the brunch rush on a Sunday, but the tables still needed to be bussed. Although we didn't wait long to get seated, the tables should still have been ready.  The hostess sat us down but we waited nearly 10 mins before waitress #2 came to ask us for drinks. The waitress (#1) that was supposed to service our table was servicing another party. But prior to asking us for drinks, the waitress #2 took drink and food orders for a couple who sat adjacent to us that arrived after us. Down the aisle another group who arrived after us got their orders taken. Waitress #2 put our orders in at the same time as the couple.  The couple received their food within 10 mins while we were waiting for ours. Another 10 mins goes by and we flagged down a random waitress asking where our food was. The manager, Jim, stops by to apologize for our wait. After 5 mins later, our food arrives. The group down the aisle got their food, finished eating, and was about to pay before we started eating. Jim offered to pay for our meal for the mistake. Apparently there was something wrong with our ticket in the kitchen.  The couple next to us finished eating after we started eating. I think they rushed my wife's hash browns because it was barely brown and she said the potatoes were still crunchy. We flagged waitress #1 about the hash browns, and her excuse was "order it extra crispy". Mind you, my hash browns were perfectly cooked and crispy without having to tell the kitchen. Waitress #2 came to apologize about our tardy food; she said she put in the ticket at the same time as the couple. My wife and I already figured this out, and we thanked her. The hash browns were replaced and again Jim came by apologize again.  As for the actual food, minus my wife's hash browns, it was really tasty. It was too bad that it was clouded by the terrible service. Hopefully we decide to come back, and it will be a better experience.

od6EgHLNefwjhO6k5JC20w.text: This new breakfast/lunch spot is located at the southeastern edge of Town Square shopping center- it's much more spacious inside than it appears. We arrived close to noon on a Saturday, and there was a decent line with a 15 minute wait- except we chose the bar so were seated immediately. Our friendly and efficient waitress gave good recommendations! We began with a mimosa flight- perfect tastes of each flavor- it was a delicious choice as we perused the large, colorful menu. I chose a "Golden State Benedict"- bacon, avocado, tomato, and 2 perfectly poached eggs with a siracha spiked hollandaise- absolutely amazing. My friend choose a breakfast taco that she compared to the flavors only previously experienced in Cancun. The meals are generously priced at less than $15 for a considerable portion of truly well-prepared food. When we were finished, we ordered blueberry smoothies for the road, and they were also fantastic. 5 stars all around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden State Benedict
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa flights
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja breakfast taco

YL2thATnmN-GX66clJVLtg.text: AMAZING BREAKFAST SPOT!!!  This is a must stop everytime we go to southern California. Now that we have one here it will be our regular breakfast spot!   We went around 630am and they already had people filling up the restaurant. By the time we left the restaurant was almost completely full. It's very spacious and also good for large partys.  Border Benedict - is an absolute must try if you like eggs benedict. The potatoes were missing flavor, inwould recommend getting beans on the side goes well with the border benedict. Orange juice was great tasted fresh and very cold.  Pancakes - Very large sized pancakes but cooked perfect and great flavor.  Service - was great multiple members of staffed checked on our party and made sure that our drinks stayed full and made sure we were happy with our meal.   Decor - Very modern style, beautiful bar and dining room.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TDB0V5VhTPatpZBKjRSr5w.text: Delicious! So convenient as a pit stop from picking up our car at the airport. Lots of yummy options on the menu and friendly staff. Perfect for my husband and I!

cgWd5IwErnbgCCjI9u0GVg.text: San Diego's best breakfast spot, right here in Vegas. Everything is reasonably priced and absolutely gourmet. I recommend the hash skillet, mouth watering for sure.

w1-jYTYDEbrtdmWtDP9ZFg.text: One of the very few things I will miss since I moved away from Las Vegas is the Broken Yolk.  I had only been a couple of times because it had just opened and then we left town.  But both times I absolutely LOVED my breakfast omelets and so did my out-of-town guests.  The make your own omelet is not a novel idea, however, the ingredients I included and the taste of the food is excellent.  Ground beef, potato and cheese omelet with a little tomatillo sauce and sour cream on the side is to die for!  I also love their breakfast potatoes, just like my mom used to make!  Definitely will go back whenever we are in town visiting!  Better yet, open a location in New Hampshire please!

DeJqn3gtofvyB57D4WwIPg.text: Our first time here, and it was a great experience. Our server Crystal was warm, friendly, helpful, and attentive. Food was generous in portions and delicious. I look forward to coming back.

jNzf9g_e-Vc9a70dKNwuOg.text: Okay, been here three times now and this is my first review. Let's start with the food.   The Benedict's are AMAZING!!!! The Sope Benny and the Border Benedict are both out of this world. Best Benny's I have ever put in my main face hole. The skillets are also top notch. Everything tastes like it's from scratch! The pancakes are fluffy but are a little doughy for my personal taste.   The service...as good as the food is this is where this store really excels. Always greeted with a smile and they hired an AMAZING staff. Came in about two weeks ago and received superior service from Chelsea. Today she asked my wife if she wanted tea and I if I wanted a cold brew. Exactly what we ordered last time...beyond impressed. This is one of our new favorites for breakfast.

Zp1AwQQ1mrRmB4vkL2jn-A.text: Best food and service... if I could give it 10 stars I would. We had guests in town and took them there 2 days in a row...

uqxLFWg_oUfWVni6R_LA6g.text: I had the veggie wrap it was simply delicious. The service was good as well. I really enjoyed myself here, spacious and great atmosphere.

_vfFxZLxNfway3QjZj2uxw.text: Legit establishment. I am somewhat of a geriatric soul and wake up at 6:00am-ish. I like a bloody mary with breakfast, but I don't want to wait until noon when all of the other whippersnappers wake up. The Broken Yolk Cafe was there for me. They also post calories, which is good for those looking to avoid being a fatty (me). Win win.

BZOcykPGAg_2VFodVAwwMw.text: What an amazing experience. My sister and I visited 6/27/19 and the food was amazing. We enjoyed it so much we went back, with friends, the next morning. The food is delicious and the service is top notch. Everyone helps each other as our table was touched by four employees to help as needed. We have a Broken Yolk Cafe at home in Bakersfield and can't wait to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My French toast breakfast.

dgSH2w45P_wXcsvU3yNFbw.text: I am once again impressed with this franchise. Second time eating at The Broken Yolk Cafe (first time was at the San Diego location). Had the chicken and waffle eggs Benedict and was very pleased. Service was awesome and location is so new you can smell the paint.  Glad we found this location away from the chaos of the Las Vegas Strip (2 miles away) and didn't pay a resort price. Will definitely return when in Vegas.

Bo7pu3f05fM8f-wuY5Atbw.text: Portions were perfect! We were out running errands all day and don't have breakfast or lunch. I was very hungry and i was more than happy about the size of my skillet. Everything was cooked perfectly and the skillet kept hot throughout the entire sitting. Typically i expect skillets to cool down as soon as i start digging in but it wasn't the case with this one. I love that! Friend ordered an omelet which aside from being loaded with goodies it also included a generous amount of fruit and a muffin on the side. Our waitress was very kind and welcoming, she gave us plenty of time to decide on what we wanted. The place is very open and there's plenty of seating throughout.

_dqiQyoj3x7GKsAuV9UbIg.text: After seeing all the great reviews on open table andYelp, I was really excited to try this place. Me and the wife came in around noon on a Monday. If you're a local, you'll know what restaurant week is.   Anyhow we come in, hostess was friendly and interior was nice. Waitress came right away and took drink orders. Shortly after food order. When you order using the restaurant week menu, you order 3 courses up front. I order the acai scoop, wild west burger with sweet potato fries, and the nutella crepe. Wife gets acai scoop, golden state Benedict, and the cinna cake.  Acai scoops come out first. It was good. Wish it had some granola in it. Then what was weird was, they brought out our deserts next and said our food was coming out. (1st course plates still on table).  so we start eating them then 2 minutes after, our entrees come out. (1st course plates still on table) desert was ok. The cinna cake was ok. The crepe was pretty good.   We start eating our entrees. The Benedict  visually looked good. Wife cuts into it and...solid yolk! Cmon! 2nd egg, same thing. Burger was poorly put together and the tooth pick holding it together was not put in all the way through. Flavor was good, execution poor. The sweet potato fries were fire tho! Super good.   I would give this place a 2nd try because of all the great reviews. But this particular visit, I wasnt impressed

OJxVNIWh4yYgfqfjEG5kQA.text: This place does breakfast right. We really enjoyed the food and friendliness of the staff. They have a wide variety of food, you can't pick a bad option. Everything is fresh, big portions and taste amazing

Q78hWpu1fhcf47i-cPzdQQ.text: Alicia was awesome. Food as beautiful as the pictures and even more delicious. I ate too fast to get pictures

htOUe8qwjJKd5o5dlZLiRw.text: Enjoyed a terrific and filling Restaurant Week breakfast for $20 this morning. They are not promoting Restaurant Week so you need to ask for a menu. You won't be disappointed.

ecppd_i2XNQYwAv6G0cylg.text: Okay, this place is a Gem! We're still about 15-20 steps away and the servers are already welcoming us. All smiles and greetings. Nope we're not the first customers, this place was already packed when we got there. In spite of the influx of customers, the staff are still all smiles and they are just radiating with positive energy. I wasn't able to take pictures as we've came from a 10-hour drive and we just want to sit and eat.  There was about a 15-minute wait when we arrived. No biggie because the staff keeps checking up on us within that 15-minute time.  My hubby ordered the Golden State Benedicts w/o the Sriracha but his food came out with Sriracha and the staff immediately gave my husband a new one the moment he informed the staff about it. I ordered the tuna sandwich-cesar salad-chicken noodle soup combo, for which I was served a Tomato Basil soup instead. The staff immediately gave me a cup of chxn noodle soup ones I informed them of the mistake and they also had me keep the tomato basil soup to try. Our kids ordered, pancakes, Chicken strips and nutella/strawberry crepes. The food taste so good and it even taste better with very nice poeple serving them.  The staff was very nice and accomodating. The manager checked on every customers. He also came to our table and chatted a little bit. This place is awesome with Awesome people and food. We are definitely recommending this place to our friends and family and this is gonna be our go to breakfast place everytime we're in town.

Ho6FWOaRKt7E8G2K8Uz-7Q.text: Really good omelette with has browns and toast. Clean, modern design. Three refills of Diet Coke for me and coffee for my wife. Food not overly seasoned... yes! Wish I had one where we live.

RL5an_LVoALI2JN0Zh0v0Q.text: New cafe with great menu and staff. Food is plentiful and fantastic. Won't be disappointed. Wish they were on the east coast too

5doBFEx09voAgYrO-ByI_Q.text: We are visiting from LA and by pure chance, we were able to find this restaurant. The food is great, the staff more than great. If you want to have delicious food away from the strip, this is the place.

D8Rcn6GjpjzwTC1TcQUCnA.text: Great food. Awesome selection. Alicia our server was the best. Always making sure everything was as we liked and was very nice to my little boys. Can't wait to come back!

zVjFcXWZirbxbfIhZId55w.text: Second day open and the food was delicious!! I've been to the one in SD a long time ago so when i saw that they were going to open one here i was excited! Our server Rusty was super helpful, friendly, and attentive. We will def be making this place a regular!

-rOktQzn1RaHdwmDUi-Q2A.text: Tried out the new breakfast spot on a Sunday morning before 9am. No waiting, was seated right away. Service was pleasant enough, forgot the toast for the skillet and the requested salsa for the omelette. But everything was hot when it came out, my son wasn't impressed with the chicken fried steak but everyone thought the eggs were better than most. Asked for, and received, crispy hash browns, the home fries were just alright. Overall not a bad experience and worth the price.

bziCvdoTyIuarI3GfGFJoA.text: We ate brunch here.  It was good food, great service. There was a hawaiian bread type sweet waffle my sister ordered. It was very good. Couldn't help but try it. I had a half soup half salad.

-6dJdNSPxWGc2n6VHd1ICA.text: Food is excellent. Their service is a little slow but I'm guessing it is because they're pretty busy. Love the variety of choices they have and the outdoor patio gives it a nice touch. Their mimosa is pretty good too. Hopefully they'll come up with more flavors. Overall it's a good place for brunch!

GMqQZaEBV0ydYD--pjV2rg.text: We had eaten at other locations and were not disappointed at this new site. Our breakfast was superb and the service was attentive. Everything was delicious and portions were plentiful. We never saw the bottom of our drinks which were quickly topped off. Will visit again during our next trip to Las Vegas.

uGoH6hm_pLOwAPvtutQ4Cw.text: Very good! The ranchero skillet was delightful. the crunchy french toast was to die for! Recommend 10/10

bMDRdqrRLQJzDIHc_41k9g.text: Ordered take out on Monday at around 11:05. At first they didn't pick up which I understand if someone else was on the line. The second time they picked up and I ordered Ham Scramble and the Acai Bowl. They said that my order would be ready in 15 minutes. Okay that's cool everything is all good but this is where everything went downhill. Arrived about 15 minutes later and paid and my food still wasn't ready. Before I could even pay, the workers were struggling to find my order because they put the wrong name down... When they found it, my food still wasn't ready. The girl said she'll go check on it but didn't come back. Asked a different worker how much longer and they told me let me go ask the manager like why do you need to ask the manager to know when my food that I ordered a long time ago over the phone to be done. She didn't even go and check or look for her manager. She literally just stood by the cash register the whole time. At this point I waited for over 30 minutes and my food ain't out and still I don't know how much longer. Thank god it came out 10 minutes later. So overall I waited 40 minutes for some scramble eggs with ham and ice cream like okay y'all really need that long to cook eggs?? I didn't even get an apology for waiting such a long ass time. Since they took so long the food better be decent. But it wasn't even edible. Scrambled eggs were a bit on the runny side. Toast were burnt. Like imagine being a restaurant that manage to burn such a simple dish like toast. The hash weren't even good. The acai bowl did not come in a BOWL like why include the BOWL in the name if the container it came in isn't even close to a BOWL. I checked it when and it was a sad melted mess probably because they took 40 minutes. At this point I don't even want to come back in and complain because it's probably gonna take them two decades to get it right. The Ham Scramble wasn't worth $8.95 and the Acai bowl is not worth $10.95 especially when I can go to Bowlology or VitalityBowls for better and cheaper bowls. I rather go to Metro Diner which is a totally better place compared to here. Can't believed I really wasted $9 for semi scrambled eggs and like five pieces tiny ass pieces of diced ham and $11 for ice cream soup that ain't serve in a bowl. Also, let's not forget the tax so I really paid like over$20 for this garbage. Never coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melted ice cream. This is depressing.
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chief called and said this ain&#39;t it.
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the burnt toast. Looking at this gives me cancer.

VI2mpx5AsniDt2vn2iBxVw.text: This place is amazing! Not only is the food delicious but the service was great too! We had the Sope Benedict which had such a unique flavor that I enjoyed ever bite! I'll order it again for sure. & recommend you try! Also, if you love good service I recommend Chelsea, she made sure we knew all the background of the food & restaurant & made us feel like we were on vacation! (& we're locals!! Lol) all in all 10/10 for me, can't wait to be back! :)

6TqqVjB8aGdTJyg1rIEutQ.text: This is my new favorite breakfast spot! I only wish they had more locations. They have a great selection of creative Benedict's! My favorite is the Caprese Benny. I can wait to go back & try the sopes Benny.

Xu6Rgw5ytcUcqqaFk2vxNQ.text: Great food and great atmosphere. The price is good for how much food they give u. Will definitely go back when in Vegas again.

7V08BQmSzH3J2m8vSfarMQ.text: Came here for breakfast. Server was Chelsea. She was very knowledgeable, fast service, great recommendations. Love that they have a full bar for Alcohol drinks, not just your ordinary breakfast spot! Will come back again, make sure to sit with Chelsea !!!

bQJA38WzJnbG2ygFD7Dgxw.text: This place is nice and clean which is awesome. Very friendly customer service.  The food however is not as good as expected.  The hollandaise sauce is not good.  It's really thick and doesn't take like traditional sauce.  There was also so much it ruined the whole Benedict.  The home fries were really great though!

VPFST4SjLhxqPxnV1P9auA.text: I went yesterday for the soft opening and Janean was patient, knowledgeable and an outright serving star. Her smile is infectious and the food is delicious! The food makes you wanna go and Janean makes you wanna return! Will be back.

1VMvxHURVoSpsUwFCHyp2Q.text: I have been awaiting this place to open and they finally did! I was excited as I walked in to see that they have a rewards program, which I LOVE! I was very pleasantly surprised that there was no wait when I got there, around 10 am. When I walked in, I was greeted with nice smiles and a "Gold" card! I get free pancakes one a week for a year! YES!!!!  There were only a limited number of the cards. Glad I got there when I did. Anywho, my server Bianca was very nice and knowledgeable being opening day. I ordered the Hash Skillet with my eggs over medium and Mother's Light IPA (or something like that not the cream soda kind). Food was delivered crazy quickly! Compared to some other places, the portion size was not as big, but is still good for the price and I couldn't finish it anyway.  I really enjoyed the skillet, only thing, I wish I had the option to order crispier potatoes, would have been better.  Otherwise, I really enjoyed my meal and the drink. Overall, I give the service 5 stars, from not just my server, Bianca, but other servers and Alexei, very, very nice young man. Glad, I live relatively close, I will definitely be back this week to get my FREE pancakes!!!!   Let me know what you think!

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash Skillet with IPA
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash Skillet with Eggs over medium.

oCtuz_EVNU8wSHWKSdocEQ.text: Been here twice. Both times the food and service were great. I've came on Sunday's so as expected there is usually a wait so don't come that hungry. Definitely worth the wait. The menu is huge and I haven't had anything I did not love. Drink menu is cool too. Assorted flights and specialty drinks. Definitely a new go to.

t7xnhrJhcJJCyCdqKuu3eg.text: We stumbled into the soft opening of The Broken Yolk Cafe and they were gracious enough to allow us to join with "friends and family". This is a great new restaurant! The service was friendly and quick, the decor was bright, modern, and comfortable, and our food was excellent! I fully intended to eat only half of my generous portion, but couldn't keep myself from finishing all the home fries. My daughters LOVED their French toast sticks and loved the options on the kids menu. The Broken Yolk has earned its way into our Sunday breakfast rotation.

vwuOBPFcxND43Z0KKDRo3g.text: First time going here and my overall experience was excellent! Food, food presentation, interior design and staff was great! Matthew, Adrian and Marcos took care of us! It's a MUST for breakfast or brunch. I'm going to go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiki toast
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles Benedict
Photo of The Broken Yolk Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8cV54kfAvWPobMjFgi0j9A.text: We went there for breakfast before we made the 5 hour drive home from Las Vegas for the weekend. Our server's Rusty and Rachel were fantastic!! The food was excellent, the service was fantastic and it was better than any buffet that you would go to on the strip!! No matter if you live in Las Vegas or you are from out of town like i was, this place is a must for breakfast or brunch. I will be coming back when i visit Las Vegas again!!

yMTb7SCwvnHd7ZvSbxEGpA.text: We just had breakfast/brunch at the Broken Yolk Cafe. The food was delicious and the service was even better. Kade who took our orders and checked on us throughout our meal was excellent and professional. We highly recommend the place.

I0FNbB0wSRFveuD5w6P2-w.text: Our first time dining at The Broken Yolk Cafe.  Had 1010 Alicia, who was our server and she was awesome.  Made recommendations and let us take our time deciding.  Breakfast was very, very good.  We went early on a Wednesday morning and Alicia said Saturday's and especially Sunday brunch are the busiest.  Can't wait to go back, but will still go during the week.

uInJ0ycXj3Q60WlW1PNXzQ.text: The food was so food (better than most our meals on the strip) and we didn't have to deal with the strip! We had the Golden State Benedict and Ranchero Skillet, we'd recommend both. Our server Alicia was kind & prompt. Overall great experience.

CH8Q9l-sR0d53UNTWUrvdA.text: So I decided to stop in here for a late breakfast. Holy shit I'm so happy I did , the food was amazing!!  I can't wait to come back again. The atmosphere here makes you feel comfortable and is very pleasing to the eye. The staff is great our waitress Chelsea was spot on. We never needed to ask for anything. I'm so looking forward to my next visit. So worth the money. Highly recommend this spot to everyone in town or just visiting.

swBar3CwYDWm56m8ooYA-A.text: Very delicious. Our server, Matthew, was super helpful with his recommendations. We we're pretty early so they had this little menu of standard breakfasts that I ordered from except it was anything but standard it was bomb. The number 1. I'd have it again for sure.  My friend ate the Golden State (Matthew's rec) and the combination of flavors was like a party on a plate. LOVED EVERYTHING!

5KlDwJJ8I_aJ98oyNdT3hA.text: Rusty is so awesome! So happy that Town Square has a real diner. Decor is cute, very welcoming and cozy. Will definitely make this place part of my rotation!!! Rusty, you are fabulous! Thanks for being on point!!

Bg9CVdlxlVCCNgCq4SP5bQ.text: Great food and service! Thanks to Alicia our server for a great experience, we will be back!! #grubkillers get the 27 Mile south chorizo omelette!

YyzsZz0FMJrGaJit4qVDYg.text: We arrived on opening day of the Las Vegas store and where happily surprised with a "1st 100 reward card".  Jim, the manager, came to the table making sure our meals were perfect.  But it was Janean, as sparkling as her makeup, who suggested many of her favorite options.  She is an asset to The Broken Yolk Cafe!!

6uULCZ2rJS5aIfnbEojWMw.text: Our hostess was nice and the place looked clean. It went downhill from there. Our waitress seemed a little annoyed with us that we took so long to order. It also seemed like she had a lot of tables to serve. The food took a very long time to come out and the waitress apologized and gave us free biscuits and a muffin. That was nice. When the food came out my friend's acai bowl was a quarter melted and they had to send back their poached eggs twice for being over cooked. Frustrating. Our waitress did take the eggs off our bill, which we appreciated. But all in all, we would never go back. We should've known never to stray from our favorite breakfast place...Babystacks.

_OEBN27as6K20fNZ0a6gYg.text: My family and I were really excited to try this place. We had been to one in San Diego and enjoyed food and atmosphere, but this was not the case for the Vegas one. My son who is 12 figured he would order food off the kids menu being he wasn't to hungry but he order his eggs the same way he does at all restaurants and at home, over easy. The manger came over and was very rude about it and said my son would have to eat scrambled eggs. I asked can i order him an adult meal instead and he said no we will not serve him over easy eggs. We have gone to Cracker Barrel, ihop, Denny's, the cracked egg, egg works, etc. and Have never had this happen or anyone be this rude! We won't back!

K0ffx-Ifnq7JhIz9OxX6dQ.text: The food was the best I have had in a restaurant in a long time. The ingredients were very fresh and our waiter Jon was on it!

ATQlpNQIh901RVew1CX_rQ.text: Horrible service! Tried to eat breakfast here this morning. Their hostess was completely incompetent and rude. We were told around a 20 minute wait for two people and added to a text alert. After about 45 minutes of waiting and watching group after group of people that came much later than us get seated we asked how much longer. The hostess didn't know who we were and couldn't find us on the list. How is this even possible with an at least partially automated system? She kept asking people who they were and seemed very mixed up. She was also quite rude to us and most people that came. After waiting another 5 minutes we asked if were were up next. She said about 15 minutes as she was seating yet another group that came probably 30 minutes after us. We left at that point. We will never be coming back. We went over to the Lazy Dog at the other end of Town Square where we were politely greeted, sat immediately, and had a nice brunch/ lunch. There are much better options than the Broken Yolk for a weekend brunch.

2N5WuDztR2sCoN5U0-7pVg.text: A new, fun spot for Breaky. The food is delicious. We ordered the Acai bowl, and Nutella crepes. Both were great. We came back the second time for the food and because our waiter Matthew is the BEST! Awesome dude with a great personality and excellent service.

2lDJ6kP6rmbi1cXykX04Vg.text: A very nice and reasonably priced Breakfast/Lunch place!  We highly recommend this restaurant and found the hostess, Faye, and our server , Bianca, to be outstanding.  Supper friendly and very nice.  The menu was quite comprehensive and the food was very good.  Overall,  a nice way to avoid the over-priced Casino Breakfasts. It's just a short drive down The Strip and we will definitely return the next time we are in Vegas. Definitely worth a visit.
